name: Oklahoma City National Memorial & Museum
address: 620 N Harvey Ave, Oklahoma City, OK 73102, USA
reviews: This is a sad event that has been remembered to the fullest by the memorial and museum. The museum is a must to truly understand the impact of the damage, the incredible response, and heroism on multiple levels. I remember the quote by, I believe, the judge preceding over the final Nichols trial. He said something to the affect that this nation that you hate is strong enough and big enough to let you escape the death penalty. That was the second time for Nicholas according to the museum display. Definitely recommend a stop if in the area.

Friendly, welcoming and helpful staff. Probably the best museum I've ever visited! Incredibly touching, beyond informative, and most of all, gives insight and understanding on the people of Oklahoma. Would love to come back for additional visits, in addition to the 4+ hours that I spent there. Absolutely agree that this is one of the "Top 10 Museums in America"!

Never forget April 19, 1985. My husband worked on the 8th floor of the federal building. We love our MEMORIAL and all the people who came to help everyone, love the survivors and we remember those who were killed. We shall never forget. It truly is a beautiful place. What was once a place of horror and death is now a place of peace and remembrance. God bless Oklahoma City. ❤

One of the better memorials we have visited. We spent about two hours there and could have stayed longer had we read every piece of available information. Interactive screens make learning more engaging for children & adults. The victims are respectfully honored here and visitors can expect complete information from the history of downtown OKC to the verdicts rendered. Having gone at 2PM on a Saturday, it was busy. I would recommend arriving in the morning on a weekend day!

Such an incredible,  somber experience. The grounds are breathtaking. A beautiful memorial for the lives lost. The reflection pool and 9:01 and 9:03 towers are amazing. If you have the opportunity to walk through and see the history of this site, please do so. It's hard to walk the grounds without getting emotional.

name: Myriad Botanical Gardens
address: 301 W Reno Ave, Oklahoma City, OK 73102, USA
reviews:
Stunningly beautiful and a family favorite! Fun areas for the dogs, the kids, and the adults! 

We actually had our wedding ceremony and reception here because we love it so much! 

The park is beautiful and the staff is passionate about their profession. The botanical gardens truly are one of the best things about downtown Oklahoma City. I highly recommend you check out the up coming events or just stop by for a stroll any time of the year!

Nice area to go for an early morning run before people start showing up. It’s an oasis of plant life downtown.  Good place for landscaping inspiration.  Plants are labeled so it’s easy to get ideas for what to plant at home. The children’s area has some interesting educational exhibits and a fun play area as well.

Pretty place to walk around, enjoy nature, take pictures and watch wildlife. We didn't go into the actual garden exhibit, but we did walk around outside and view the scenery. The outdoor theater is pretty neat, saw a show there once.

I went to the light show here just before Christmas and it was absolutely lovely. The way they had it set up was amazing to see with the pretty lights, the atrium, and the music. I hadn't been inside it until then and being that it was my first time seeing all of that, it was definitely eye catching. I loved it. I was visiting the city and ended up finding that, and that definitely ended my night in the city perfectly.

The main section of the garden in indoor and well maintained. The butterfly section has been moved outdoor and is seasonal. The tulip decorations were amazing, although few items like fish pond could have been better maintained. Overall, worth a visit.

name: Oklahoma City Zoo
address: 2000 Remington Pl, Oklahoma City, OK 73111, USA
reviews: Love, love, love the zoo. The membership is reasonable and even a bonus with children!!  I only wish I could go more often. There’s always remarkable and beautiful renovations and additions, it’s always new yet my old favorites remain and keep getting better. You haven’t seen Oklahoma if you haven’t been to this zoo and botanical garden.

We love the Zoo!! There are tons of animals, all in a comfortable space and taken care of. There are food options in multiple locations around the zoo and several areas for kids to play. My son loves to climb on the animal statues and have me take his picture. There's lots of greenery and maps posted everywhere. You can pay extra for things like camel rides, giraffe feeding, elephant shows, etc. There's also a tram for $6 I believe. And of course bathrooms and a gift shop. You can rent strollers as well. We have a family pass that lasts a year and we will be renewing it for next year as well.

Second time here. Lorikeets are awesome. Zoo is making serious headway in a modernization effort. Everything is well maintained and clean. Staff were all very friendly and informative. There is something to see and do for all ages. Great playgrounds and picnic area when it's time for a break. Easy to see why it's one of the top ten in the country. We will come again.

Amazing experience! We loved all the animals. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The park is clean, the restrooms are clean. A variety of foods, concessions, and souvenirs are available for decent prices. We love the photo booth pictures that are available several places around the park. The animals seem to be well taken care of, and the zoo keepers post notes on the exhibits if there are any medical concerns about the animals. There's also several different opportunities to feed or interact with the animals throughout the zoo.

We can’t express how grateful we are for the Oklahoma City Zoo.  They have given my Son so many opportunities to grow and engage with beautiful world we live in.  The elephant experience is worth hike to see the whole gang, then stop by to see the rhinos!  The monkeys never disappoints.  And it’s always necessary to take the back route to see the giraffes.  The Oklahoma trail to by our favorite, to come up close and personal with so many wonderful creations!

name: 45th Infantry Division Museum
address: 2145 NE 36th St, Oklahoma City, OK 73111, USA
reviews: It had a ton of cool exhibits and artifacts. The outdoor area was very cool with many different vehicles and artillery units. Our tour guide was very knowledgeable and had served in Vietnam.
So many memories...so much History... SOo many beauty Boys and Up standing women. To be remembered here. "Never for get those that made the way... So that you could be here today"- T.I.

On our way back from the Softball complex we stopped in to view the display of tanks, guns, and military vehicles. I am a Vietnam Veteran, and I got to see first had a lot of the equipment that was in use during my tour overseas. I enjoyed being able to go unclose to look at the various pieces of equipment. I really enjoyed being able to explain a lot of the equipment to my grandson. He's seen picture and film of the gear, but had not seem it up close. It is an impressive display. The grounds are well cared for, and the equipment is clean, presentable, with great explanation of what they items are. Good job.
Free. Can't beat that. Lots of awesome history on display. Fascinating stuff. Go at your own pace or we ever had a volunteer take us on a bit of a tour as our guide. Highly recommend you visit.

Amazing collection and knowledge of all the legendary wars going back to the civil war. Was fascinated with all the world war II axis and allied rifles machine guns metals uniforms etc, just amazing!
Free to get in but please don't be cheap, donate a little something at the desk when you walk in keep this place up and running and these timeless pieces available for viewing

name: Museum of Osteology
address: 10301 S Sunnylane Rd, Oklahoma City, OK 73160, USA
reviews: I love the Museum of Osteology. For a small building, it is packed full of bones! They even display their bone cleaning process when you walk in. They provide a scavenger hunt for kids and multiple educational experiences. While I have yet to be able to cash in on one, I hope to do one soon. Great for kids, but also adults!

I brought two kids here looking for an easy way to spend part of a day.  There was enough here to entertain a 3 year old and a 5 year old for quite a while.  They got a scavenger hunt paper to work on, the prize was some candy.  I enjoyed it as well.  It is a small building,  so it's not overwhelming.   I really enjoyed it.
Such a neat, educational place! Always a fun trip! I really enjoying staying up to date with their social media. They always post really neat things!

Very cool and informative. Loved seeing the morphological differences in the different  dog skull’s, but the hippo skeleton was probably my favorite. Definitely a place to check out of you are in to science or have kids.
This place is amazing. I'm not even big into astrology and I had an absolute blast here. Also the gift shop is fairly price and of course the owl pellets are awesome.

name: Science Museum Oklahoma
address: 2020 Remington Pl, Oklahoma City, OK 73111, USA
reviews: I used to come here as a kid and love bringing my toddler here when we visit. There are so many types of exhibits for children (and adults) of all ages with different interests. Love that there is a separate toddler area with a door to keep them from getting run over by the older kids and there’s even a nursing room inside the toddler area. Great place to visit!

Wonderful suggestion by the hotel staff. This place is huge and it has so much stuff for the kids to see and plenty of hands-on activities. The kids could have easily stayed all day. 

I also LOVED the cycling exhibit!

I remember visiting the museum when I was a kid and having a blast. I met one of the employees recently (Barry) and he recommended I take my kids, I couldn't believe this was the same place, it's so much better now. My kids had a great time and we will definitely be back. I highly recommend the Science Museum to anyone.

It's a spacious place to hang out with friends and do some cool ( and educational ) activities. I can imagine a family easily spending a whole day here. It's always nice to see when they bring in new interactive displays and update material. It's definitely worth a visit if you're in the area with a young family and looking for something to do.
very very fun place for kids to go to. has all sorts of cool stuff kids could do. if their board this is the place to take  them. you wont regret taking them here. awsome place ! thanks ! - sunshine

name: Will Rogers Gardens
address: 3400 NW 36th St, Oklahoma City, OK 73112, USA
reviews: A charming utopia overflowing with botanical beauties. I popped into the cactus garden area on a whim. Then, after wandering for a bit, was invited to see the inner greenhouses. A very knowledgeable curator showed me their current projects. It felt like a unique private tour. I will be back to volunteer.

Since leaving and now returning with to visit family in the Metro area, I am discovering all the wonderful things the north side of Oklahoma City has that I never knew about growing up here. This is another one of those. It is a wonderful little place to go for a stroll. The buildings were closed on the day we were there (Christmas Eve, they are closed all city holidays), but the outdoor spaces were nice on such a pleasant December day. I am sure it would be an amazing place in the spring.

Beautiful place to go! Excellent for taking beautiful pictures! 📷 I really love to go here to observe nature and relax. Spring time is when most beautiful it is! It also has a flower garden named Iris Garden within the Will Rogers Garden. They are connected.
Beautiful Gardens and fountains. Trail/sidewalks to walk. Laces to stop and sit to rest. Very nice

We love going to this park to take pictures of our kids or just walk around. It is always lovely no matter what time of the year. I do wish they were open past 5 some days for when we are trying to take pictures.

name: Oklahoma City Museum of Art
address: 415 Couch Dr, Oklahoma City, OK 73102, USA
reviews: I loved my day at the Museum today.  There is a wide range of different types of art;  Also, places where you can add your own artistic touch. I added some pictures to convey what I enjoyed most.

I really enjoyed this museum. We went when they had the Great Depression era art which was somber yet deep and very enlightening. Also, this museum has a permanent installation of Dale Chihulys glass exhibit which was beautiful and not crowded at all when we went. The museum is a good size, only about 3 floors and you can get through it pretty quickly and efficiently. If you have a Bank of America credit card you get in for free.

Loved the chihuly exhibit. Truly stunning! Inexpensive rates and the hallway is gorgeous. I am in love with the space and visit it every few months. Be sure to check the days before you make the trip though

I loved the Chihuly Exhibition! A very easy to maneuver museum and it adheres to a variety of tastes in art, there is a little something for everybody! The pictures below are from the minimalism exhibition and the Chihuly "Magic and Light" exhibition. Very calm and quiet and the entire museum is very clean and organized with simplicity in mind. The arts are spaced in a strategic manner which allows you to really take in each peace without interference of another work. Pricing is cheap also and college students get a discount which is a plus!♡

Great experience for my son and I. He is one little and young artist. He was amazed by all kinds of art we saw, from abstract to the art made by a simple pencil. 
We love it.

name: Will Rogers Park
address: 3400 NW 36th St, Oklahoma City, OK 73112, USA
reviews: I dont see any pictures here but there are "fairy trees" popping up all over the park. Adorable and great for kids to look for as they walk through the park. They have cute colorful tiny doors on various trees, down low and higher up on the tree. Some have windows or steps. Kids love it!.. Great job ! To who ever is in charge of creating this project.

I spent time inside the pavilion the greenhouse pavilion. every year we have a Valentine's party in there and that part is nice. the park is nice as well in the spring but sometimes it can get a little raunchy with all the geese there that just makes messes. and then sometimes the summer months make the flowers look dead and I think they just need to be watered a little better. But overall I think it's a nice park.
This place is so beautiful! 🙌 The natural landscape is great for pictures. I actually had a first date here and loved it so much I started walking my dog here.

The daffodils and crocuses are blooming in early spring, so the gardens are beautiful.  The park is well maintained. My favorite part of my visit was finding the little fairy houses and doors throughout the park!

Such a beautiful park! I had no idea of all its beauty. A great stop for a relaxing and tranquil walk in nature. An immersive escape from the hustle bustle of your day to day...
Some of my photography below...hope you enjoy this virtual and photographic journey...😎📸

name: Centennial Land Run Monument
address: 200 Centennial Ave, Oklahoma City, OK 73102, USA
reviews: Really neat monument with some interesting history information scattered throughout the walking path to provide context. I would recommend taking time to walk the river path and stop by the monument.
The statues are just beautiful. There are quite a few of them. Brings back the old west.

What an awesomely extraordinarily Beautiful Family experience. U know U can't imagine how Large and Exceptional the Quality of these Bronze Statues are until you are in their Presence. What Beautiful craftsmanship and true to Life they are. WOW I mean WOW. Thanks Oklahoma city for the Maps project. Finally a GREAT place for BOTH Family and friends. Shalom SHABBAT
Life like portrayal of the land run. Beautiful work by the artist.

There are 45 larger-than-life bronze sculptures that capture the moment just after the starting gun fired signaling the opening of the Oklahoma Territory. Frozen in time are the images of frenzied citizens rushing to claim land as a wagon dropped it's load, a rider on horseback stumbles, dogs race to catch up, hats fly, rabbits scurry to get out of the way, carriages race to catch up, horses balk at the a water crossing, etc... This beautiful sculpture wonderfully catches the motion and chaos that ensued that day. It's a great place to chat with a friend and wonder about the back stories of those who participated that day. We spent and hour here and I could have used about 20 minutes longer. It's really worth seeing.

name: Frontier City Theme Park
address: 11501 N I- 35 Service Rd, Oklahoma City, OK 73131, USA
reviews: It's a really fun little park. It's very small as far as theme parks go. Pretty sure there is price gouging going on here. I understand it's a theme park and high prices are to be expected, but it's taken to a new extreme here. The service you get is minimal. Most employees in the food service parts are very rude. Just be prepared for that. Definitely eat before hand, you'll save at least 40 to 70 dollars depending on your family. The rides are a lot of fun, they have various sorts of small coasters to ride on, and plenty of things to do for the younger kids. It has a western theme that is really neat to experience. Overall a fun little place to go and spend the day with your family. Just make sure your have enough money to pay for food if you plan to eat there.

This is a great place to introduce kids to rides! The main rides aren't as thrilling as others I've rode in the past, but they are fair and since my kids like them; we can ride together.  I prefer other Six Flags parks myself, but since they've recently purchased this park I hope they introduce new, more thrilling rides. 

This park has a great children's area with better than par children's rides, a massive playground city, and a huge water area for everyone to splash around and cool off in the summer.

The food in the park is what you'd expect from a theme park. They seem to have a few better options than other parks I've visited -   loaded brisket french fries, for example.  Super salty, but very good until you can't bare the salt anymore. Burgers, pizza, corn dogs, and chicken tenders are the norm otherwise.  I recommend the meal plan if you intend to visit more than once. It pays for itself quickly.  If you upgrade to deluxe, you get a refillable drink bottle good for the entire year. Even when most of the food places have been closed in the past, the lines weren't too long so it wasn't inconvenient.  

The park is always clean which is a contrast to the park in Arlington (even though Arlington has better rides).  I recommend this park for a fun day with the family. Season passes for those who live nearby will prove advantageous for something to do on the weekends, evenings, or when they host concerts.  The best part is they're good for all Six Flags parks.

This place is a lot of fun. To get the best parking and to get to the rides quickly, it is best to go when they first open.
If you buy your season tickets and meal passes when they start running their end of season specials, you can save a bunch of money. 
This year the specials were for the rest of 2019 and all of 2020. We went enough this year to more than cover what everything combined cost so next year is going to no added cost. 
BTW, the end of season specials also included free parking so that alone is $20 a trip

The price is high (for what is offered), but overall a nice place. Since Six Flags bought the park, the season tickets are much more valuable in my opinion. 

The festivals (Holiday in the park, Haunt the Park) arr great times to take kids since the park is just do lit up and festive. 

Without a season pass, it is harder to recommend. But if you are going to go, just buy a season pass since it is only like $30 for the season ticket.

We had a really enjoyable time with all the Christmas decorations. Didn't have to wait too long in most lines. Some of the rides were down, but there were plenty open. The food is super expensive here, so eat before you go.

name: Bricktown Water Taxi
address: 111 S Mickey Mantle Dr, Oklahoma City, OK 73104, USA
reviews:
We were a little skeptical about this tour because of the mixed reviews, but I am glad we did it. The taxi and clean and comfortable, the river walk is nice. Our tour guide Penny was so kind and funny. She explained a lot of historical facts about the city and the river walk. The horse statues were impressive. I will recommend to do it around 5pm so you will see everything and also the lights that go all over the river. 
It was a 45 minutes tour. This is a must do I. Oklahoma City.

Wonderful experience and a fair price.  I was so favorably impressed with the Bricktown Canal and all the beautiful scenery, birds, restaurants, hotels and businesses in the Bricktown, Oklahoma City area.  The Bricktown Water Taxi is THE way to take it all in and enjoy the beautiful surroundings.
The quality of the tour guides varies with some being very knowledgeable about the history of Oklahoma, the Oklahoma City downtown and Bricktown itself while some "boat captains" are obviously rather new to the area and still learning.  But nevertheless, I highly recommend the Bricktown Water Taxi.

Our family enjoyed getting on the water taxi and hearing a little of OKC's history.  The tour guides are very knowledgeable about their city.  Some of them are also very funny.  You can take the whole ride and listen to the tour.  You can also get off at any stop along the way.  Your ticket is good for the whole day.   You can buy them via the mobile AP or at a ticker booth. There are numerous places to eat along the canal.  There is also an arcade and a mini golf course.  This is a great way to see the canal without having to walk all of it.

A very cool canal ride through Bricktown.  The 45 minute ride is narrated.  Expect details descriptions of murals, sculpture, construction of the canal, history of the area/canal and information about all the restaurants and establishments you pass.  Enjoyable and educational.  Fare is reasonable and is good all day.
Gave me a San Antonio feel. Tour guide was great. We were able to take really nice pictures along the route. Just wished it was a little longer.

name: Wheeler Ferris Wheel
address: 1701 S Western Ave, Oklahoma City, OK 73109, USA
reviews:
The Ferris wheel is pretty cool. This is probably the coolest thing at Wheeler park. 

The views are cool. You can sit at least 4 people in a bucket, so this is fun to do with another person or a couple extra people. 

I think going on the Ferris wheel is worth doing at least once. Try to go during a good time for views like sunset. This is a decent spot for part of a date. 

This is worth checking out at least once.

I read all reviews on it before visiting this place last week and many of them told its best to visit during night.well, its good little place for kids and adults to enjoy,with play area and swings. Only issue was, the place is at a remote location and the entrance road is very narrow with no lights in the parking area which creeps you out..! I wish we would have visited during day time.

The weather was perfect and it was just a really great experience. I Donely six dollars for a ride and $20 for a season pass, it’s a really great value too. The employees are super sweet and it is dog friendly, even on the Ferris wheel. It was absolutely wonderful. It was a little busy, so I will come back again and see if I can’t get into one of those hammocks.
love this place kids friendly we had alot of fun. love the ferris wheel you can see all okc through.. highly recommended

Hosting large events at Wheeler Park is a great idea. There is plenty of parking, the view is great, and it's so close to the walking and riding path by the canal. I was there for the American Cancer Society event and it was the perfect venue.

name: Oklahoma History Center
address: 800 Nazih Zuhdi Dr, Oklahoma City, OK 73105, USA
reviews: So much to learn here! It's set up in such a way that it shows history as more than just facts and figures but as a relevant story. And the story is about the state as whole throughout decades and centuries. It includes the different cultures of Oklahoma as well with the Native American exhibits, the vintage kitchen, the horse-drawn carriages, the television displays, and even a Sonic display. I thought it was really neat being able to learn about things about towns I've grown up in and traveled to. It's definitely worth a visit.
Thoroughly impressed. Under $20 for a family of 7! We stayed having fun and learning for over 3 hrs!! Great for kids with lots of hands on learning. Even a small gift shop.

Okay, here's a free trick, as you enter the center there are two feedback portals on either side, be sure to give the feedback after you finish the tour and Before you get into the gift shop, you get discounts upto 10% 😉 You're welcome! Now the Center itself is Extensive and Beautiful. Book a Whole Day! Take the Kids definitely. There is so much for them to do with the Center's "Hands in History" initiative! I was tired from walking around the Indoor exhibits only! And then there's Outdoor exhibits. You donot want to miss this one. The Gift has such beautiful items, Do get yourself a Dreamcatcher! Or the Chiming Hearts!

The Museum is large, and has several galleries to explore on a few floors. The Exhibits are fantastic. Everything is laid out and organized well. In some rooms, there was too much stuff, but we did come out learning quite a bit about Oklahoma. We enjoyed the quick glimpses and the overview in all the rooms, but we particularly liked the exhibits devoted to OKC’s commercial history, the Vietnam War and the local soldiers, the 39 Tribal Native American Tribes, the Steamboat “Heroine”, and the oil and gas industries. The airplane “Winnie Mae” and the Helicopter hanging on the ceilings were intriguing.
I had fun visiting this place. My favorite part of the museum was Tribes. The staff was very friendly and everything was clean and organized.

name: 21c Museum Hotel Oklahoma City
address: 900 W Main St, Oklahoma City, OK 73106, USA
reviews:
What an amazing place this is! It is such a gem that needs to be shared. The bottom floor is a FREE museum that had amazing art. The tour by the art director was phenomenal - I would highly recommend doing it! 
Our room was incredible. Because it's an old manufacturing plant, there are windows everywhere and the natural light is wonderful, especially as we had a corner room. It has such unique and thoughtful aspects throughout, such as carpets that resemble tire tracks (a nod to Ford building cars there) & the faucet handles are the same design as Model-T steering wheels! 
The staff was INCREDIBLE during our stay! There was a little hiccup but they more than compensated us for our trouble, which wasn't really trouble at all!
It's a bit in the pricey side but it's not just a place to sleep at night. You get an incredible experience. So if that's what you're looking for, this is it! I can't wait to return in the future!

I had really high hopes for staying here, but it really was just okay. Yes the hotel is very cool, modern and artsy, but was it worth the price? Probably not. We had a pillow in our room that was noticeably dirty like actual mud looking spots. Had we noticed this before coming back to our room close to 1 am we probably would have requested a new room, but it was Valentines Day and we were tired. That pillow was moved to the floor. The bed and remaining pillows were less then comfortable compared to all the other hotels we have stayed at. It was a fun experience but we wouldn't stay there again. Also - I should have said something to the staff about the room being dirty when we saw or checked out, but I don't like confrontation.  =/

A wonderful experience! The hotel is unique I'm that the first floor is a museum with rooms on the other 3 floors. We stayed in a corner suite for Valentine's Day and our room was fantastic and reminiscent of an apartment in NYC. We received a free voucher for breakfast in bed the following morning which was also very good. Excellent service and a great location to walking distance of several bars and restaurants including Joey's Pizzeria which had outstanding Italian food!

Love Love Love this place!!! If you've never been to a 21C hotel, put it on your list. This is a diamond in the rough. From the moment you arrive, you are greeted curb side by the valet crew lead by Simon and Caleb who go out of there way to make sure you have anything you need to make your stay enjoyable. Hotel has a free shuttle that will take you anywhere in the downtown area and pick you up when you're done. 
The Building is an old Ford assembly plant from the turn of the century that has been painstakingly preserved to capture the essence of the era. First floor encompasses a top notch restaurant and full service bar and the remainder floor space is the 21st Century Art Museum. 
The next three floors house the 135 rooms that range from double queen to a variety of King Studios all the way to 2 bedroom Suites.
The rooms are enormous with ceilings that exceed 15 feet.You will not be disappointed by the size of the rooms.
There are currently 11,  21C hotels in the works throughout the states so be sure to check there website and find one near you.
Oklahoma City is an up and coming city that young millennials are flocking too. Great new restaurants abound and micro pubs popping up everywhere. If you are looking for a place to live or just passing through town, put this must stay on your list.

Outstanding! I loved this hotel!! The artwork was phenomenal and our rooms were very nice and roomy!! The customer service was also above expectations. We ate and indulged in adult beverages that were impressive! You will not be disappointed!

name: National Cowboy & Western Heritage Museum
address: 1700 NE 63rd St, Oklahoma City, OK 73111, USA
reviews: This is really a wonderful place to go. There is so much history here of our nation. And what better place to have it than in Oklahoma! Our tour guide was very friendly and knowledgeable. The art there is really something to behold. I have very little interest normally in art but this was different. It really was great. Such wonderful scenery in the paintings. Besides art there is so much about the west here as well. It’s basically an untold story of cowboys and the west and the museum does a perfect job of explaining that history. Definitely a place to take your out-of-town friends and even go yourself if you’re a local. Guaranteed, you will learn something new.

Woody, Jessie and Bullseye were riding a stage in the first hallway. This is a great place to take kids. Teach them our recent past and they will be better equipped to build the future. Sit in a stagecoach, walk the boardwalks in an old west TOWN! They are adding on! It is only going to get better. If you haven't been, shame on you. It is an Oklahoma jewel.

Would Highly recommend.  This was one of the best Museum's I have ever been to.  This Museum is HUGE and has an outside area to view as well as inside.  This place is so huge you can definitely get lost.  You will definitely need to set aside about 2 hours as there is so much to see.
Lots of History and exhibits inside.  Spacious atmosphere.   You can take a tour or go off on your own, which we did.  We loved the self pace of it.  A Beautiful place to visit.

This is a great museum. There were very impressive exhibits in here. I liked one on the Western movie posters throughout history. Film highly interests me and seeing how the posters evolved over time allowed me to feel like I was involved with the history for having seen some of the films.

My other favorite part was the Western town recreated in immersive details. If you’re thinking about going here, go! I saw a lot of things I didn’t even know I wanted to see.

name: Crystal Bridge
address: 301 W Reno Ave, Oklahoma City, OK 73102, USA
reviews: Was hoping there would be more to see around the bridge building itself, but they had plenty of neat plants to see and signs telling you about many of them. Steps take you under a waterfall and up to a elevated walkway with even more plants to see. Pricey to visit here, but it was nice.

The Crystal Bridge at Myriad Gardens in Oklahoma City is a great place to warm up on a cold, dreary day.  Especially if you like tropical plants and waterfalls.  Although most of the areas are easily accessible, climbing stairs will give you a better view of the interior of the building.  Outdoor grounds are free but there is a fee for the indoor gardens.

Great place for photos. Several other people in the exhibit at the same time. Lots of neat flowers and botanicals.

Front desk staff was super friendly. 
 Cost was $17 + for 2 adults
Only bummer was the elevator was out...but I didn't mind taking the stairs. (Calorie burner)

Bathrooms had changing station - awesomeness!!!

 Very clean and picked up rain forest. 

Staff was friendly!

Keep up the good work.

Respectfully,
Bryan
Yukon, Oklahoma

Very nice place to visit. The price is a little high if you aren't going to be there long, but the experience is quite pleasant. Nice to walk amongst so many levels of flora. Not wheelchair/stroller accessible, though there is an elevator with limited accessibility. Would recommend.
Well worth the time and price. One of my favorite things we did when we traveled to OKC.

name: Riversport Adventures
address: 800 Riversport Dr, Oklahoma City, OK 73129, USA
reviews: Love, love. First time we did all the land adventures. Excellent chalkenges for the whole family, all ages, skill levels and sense of adventures!  Second visit did all the water. Rafting was excellent, guides were friendly, amazing and fun! Great for the whole family and all ages! Definitely will be back for years to come!

The skipper was awesome and was interactive with my young 4 and 1 year old and was knowledgeable of the area as he was giving a tour. The deckhand, not so much (glasses and shaved head). He was very creepy and was on his phone the entire time. I could tell he did not like kids and even shut the door on them. The experience was great though, we still had a great time.

The facility itself is amazing. Hoping management can make some changes for a fun and helpful staff and to make a way for things not to be closed down all the time. Be sure to call ahead before you buy a day pass because there could be a lot of things shut down. A friendly and excited staff would be a great change for this place! It has the potential to  truly be an OKC gem.

The whitewater rafting is awesome. Our guide Ricky was upbeat and made sure we had a great time. The zip line, however, took forever. It took over 2 hours. The food is expensive but that was expected. Definitely plan on renting a locker. Fun to go one time to experience it.

You know when you see this place from the highway it looks cool but when you get there and see it all up and close it's more than amazing. There's so many things to do so many activities great place for families

name: Orr Family Farm
address: 14400 S Western Ave, Oklahoma City, OK 73170, USA
reviews:
A great place to be a big kid or play with your little ones. Lots of fun outdoor activities including tricycle racing balloon bouncing and painting for crystals. Petting zoo with goats and sheep. Feed cups for only $1 a piece. 
my only complaint is that there was no attendance at the tricycle racing and there were a lot of abandoned bikes out on the track. as much as we spent to get in the door you think they'd be able to afford someone to keep up with that.

My kiddo loves coming here.  It's a must fall family tradition.  Lots of great fun, and photo opportunities.  Even when it's very busy it never feels overly crowded and there is so much to do that you are never just standing around waiting.  Almost everything is included in the admission price, and the add-on prices are very nominal.

We took our grandsons to enjoy the beautiful fall day. We had never been here before, but had heard a lot of wonderful things, so finally got the chance to try it and we had a wonderful time. The price is very reasonable for what you get and our eight year old grandson had a wonderful time and was completely worn out by the time we made it home. He enjoyed the carousel, the train, playing all of the various activities that they have. The park is really in great condition and the staff is very friendly and helpful. Would highly recommend for a day with the kids! We will be back when they are here for a visit again!!!
So much fun! We went and despite the poor weather there was so much fun to be had. Everyone was really friendly and my daughter had a great time. If you haven't been. Orr family farm is a must visit.
Great Place for a Fun Family Day! Lots to do for kids and adults alike!

name: American Banjo Museum
address: 9 E Sheridan Ave, Oklahoma City, OK 73104, USA
reviews: A lot of fun. Great history. Amazing craftsmanship on some of these banjos. We had fun timing through there. Military discount! Pretty good gift shop where you can even buy a quality starter banjo and books. Great location near Bricktown. Definitely recommended.

Took advantage of the Smithsonian Day to finally see this well-presented display. We are not musicians, but it was enlightening to see the history and development of the instrument showing its changing role in American culture. So many of the banjos displayed are works of art in themselves. Beautiful. The text actually enriches the understanding of what is seen and the videos and sound bring the museum to life. Glad we got to see the Jim Henson exhibit and the Jim Bollman Collection, as well. Just an overall great afternoon.
awesome musuem! loved learning about banjos and I got to see the amazing craftmanship of these instruements...

Fun history and some neat banjos.  Their traveling exhibits were fun.  I wish they had more ways to hear and see famous performances listen to examples etc.  There were a few QR codes but not every one has a phone QR code reader or knows how to use one.
Great and informative. Much to read and many, many banjos. Great place to pass the time.

name: Oklahoma Firefighters Museum
address: 2716 NE 50th St, Oklahoma City, OK 73111, USA
reviews: Great little Museum.  Would highly recommend to see.  Was not busy and had plenty ofnitems to see and loved the outside Memorial.  Does cost $6 to enter the inside Museum but is well worth it

Great museum! I’ve driven by for years but I had never been in before, glad I finally stopped to look inside. Wonderful collection of patches from fire departments from all over the world, nicely organized. Beautifully restored historic fire engines & other memorabilia 👩‍🚒 🚒 . I enjoyed my visit 👍🏻

This was a great place to visit!  The price was reasonable and the visit was well worth it.  The docent was very knowledgeable and seemed to enjoy talking about different things in the museum and answering questions.

My 11 year old daughter loved it, my 9 and 7 year old daughters had more fun playing on the playground.  While we were there we saw a couple of younger kids that were thrilled seeing all the older fire trucks inside!

There is a memorial, small playground and a couple of old fire trucks outside that is free to see.
Cool little museum to visit with lots of history. The guy working the counter wasn’t very helpful, but I enjoyed the experience!

This hidden gem near the zoo is full of information, everyone was so kind and helpful as well as VERY knowledgeable! Admission is inexpensive and there is a playground out front for the kids. Great way to spend some time learning and playing.

name: Paseo Arts District
address: 3022 Paseo, Oklahoma City, OK 73103, USA
reviews: This place is hopping on First Friday. Some food and other services limited due to crowds. Many or maybe all Art Galleries open. Street performances and vendors. Parking is at a premium. Suggest bicycle or ride share services

There are a ton of doggy friendly businesses in Paseo, it was fantastic. My little Bat-Dog (Buster) and I had a blast going around the different places and everyone being so friendly to all of the dogs around. 10/10.
Great place to go for quality live performances, shop custom creations & enjoy unique cuisine.

We were in the area for the Arts Festival and had an amazing time. We loved the booths, the live music, the outdoor art, and the permanent shops. Looking forward to returning during non-fest time to try out some of the restaurants and definitely want to return to Literati Press Book Shop where we picked up some new reads.
Great place to walk around when you don’t want to sit home. Lots of cute shops and places to eat.

name: Earlywine Park
address: 3101 SW 119th St, Oklahoma City, OK 73170, USA
reviews: The park is well maintained and has plenty of space for activities.  There are tennis courts and soccer fields along with a 1.5 mile track around the park.  There are playgrounds and even a water park, which is open during the summer months only.  There is also an facility that houses a gym.  This is a very nice park that is utilized by people from all age groups.

Earlywine Park is a nice place to be able to go if you want to bring the kids to enjoy the playgrounds, or if you want to enjoy the mile and a half property sized walk track. There's also the miniature water park with a few automated slides and the local YMCA. It's an enjoyable place to go

The 6 lane pool is perfect for laps, walking, or deep water exercise. I like the showers with curtains and a bench in each stall, spacious locker room and bathrooms, plus clean towels. Lots of options for exercise classes and an updated gym area.

Nice park with a paved walking path which indicates the distance you’ve gone.. it’s a fairly small park, but has a nice playground area, lots of shade trees, a picnic shelter. The downside is the limited green space. There’s a swimming pool though.

As a family we love this place.  We live in Mustang and wish it was closer. There is a nice track, many fields for soccer, football, baseball, frisbee, whatever needs wide open spaces.  We have used the YMCA that is in the middle of the park and we love that place as well.  They have put on a US Triathalon Assoc. Youth swim and sprint event that our kids participated in and really enjoyed. The only main complaint or suggestion that we would have for the park is: MORE/BETTER restrooms!!

name: Martin Park Nature Center
address: 5000 W Memorial Rd, Oklahoma City, OK 73142, USA
reviews: Super fun with family and kids. They have a kids playground and lots of trails. I wouldn't run here and it's not stroller friendly but my 2 & 4 year old love walking around. The route are easily made shorter for kids. Make sure you wear bug repellent especially for ticks. There is a visiting center with lots to do. They have a story time every week. It's also fun to go for a day date or just walking alone.

The perfect little oasis in the suburbs!  This parks gives you a  tastes of everything nature could offer.  An incredible park, with activities for all ages. And a Beautiful trail that allows for you to explore and enjoy your surroundings!

Small wildlife ecosystem which is sweet and simple, very pure and has good nature spots. Best time to visit is in the morning around sunrise to avoid crowds and enjoy wildlife. It has lots of deers, armadillos.and many bird species which can easily be sighted during dawn/dusk.

It's an AWESOME Place! Me and the kids where one with nature. We saw all sorts of critters , fish (tons) and birds all around us. COMPLETELY SUBMERGED IN NATURE AND LESS THAN A MILE FROM MERCY HOSPITAL... UNBELIEVABLE!!! YOU HAVE TO SEE THIS PLACE. 😃

An absolutely beautiful park with trails in N OKC. A small visitor's center with some cool exhibits and a playground for kids. The trails are well marked and easy to navigate. Several bird watching areas and so many beautiful water spots. I highly recommend. No pets allowed.

name: Harn Homestead
address: 1721 N Lincoln Blvd, Oklahoma City, OK 73105, USA
reviews: The entire property is very large. It consists of a few homes, a large Barn, a pretty gazebo, a small school, and several beautiful metal sculptures scattered all around. We walked around and found everything very interesting – the original buildings, the furnishings, the artifacts, clear labeling, and informative placards. We were also impressed by the efforts of the Oklahoma City Historical Preservation Commission to preserve everything as nicely as possible.

Very lovely place to step back into time! I remember coming here as a child on a field trip and now as an adult with my homeschooled children. Very friendly staff. Knowledgeable on their history of the Harn family and the plantation. Recommend this for anyone. (Involves a lot of walking.)
Beautiful venue in the heart of OKC! Very picturesque and rustic. We attended my brother in law's memorial here and it was the perfect place to have a celebration of life party.
Wonderful. Many buildings were closed for the land run. I would like to go back when they are open as well.
Not much of a museum but several interesting and hands-on exhibits of 89er time. Well worth a stop.

name: Stockyards City Main Street
address: 1305 S Agnew Ave #2427, Oklahoma City, OK 73108, USA
reviews: Stockyards Stampede Saturday October 20th, 2018. What a great event it was started off with stampeded through Main Street, awesome gun fights on streets, free foods and many cowboys on horse and guitar singers to entertain spectators. Good restaurants and Western wears to eat and shop while you wait in between events.
Visited several businesses and all the staff we came in contact was friendly and courteous.
It's a fun place, but I'd be careful at night walking alone.
What family friendly fun! Who doesn't love a Christmas parade that kicks off with Oklahoma long horn steer?!?!

Not sure what the problem is here, but the business folks are not friendly, in general. Sure, I'm sure some of them will smile at you on occasion, but on my last visit to this neighborhood, I couldn't tell if I was welcome at these establishments or not.

name: Oklahoma Railway Museum
address: 3400 NE Grand Blvd, Oklahoma City, OK 73111, USA
reviews: We took our kids on "The Polar Express" over Christmas.  My 11 and 8 year old absolutely loved it.  My 15 year old liked it more than he would let on.  It's an expensive event but very memorable.   The museum itself looked very interesting with lots of old equipment and memorabilia.   Hope to travel back there this summer and see all they offer during the regular season

I liked it but most of the train cars were locked so couldn’t go in them but I’ll probably go back when the weather warms hope so hopefully they’ll be open then. 

Great collection of trains & looks like they have train cars you can rent for Birthday Parties & special events so that’s pretty neat if you know a train enthusiast. Admission to the museum was free but looks like they have events at other times that have ticket prices attached to them. I’ll try again later  in the year when you can ride one of their trains. Still a fun place to check out on an afternoon 👍🏻🚂

This place was amazing for kids. They perform the Polar Express Movie around Christmas time. They were phenomenal while performing. Would highly recommend. They give the kids the golden tickets, hot chocolate, and cookies all while performing. Amazing hands down.
Train ride was entertaining, the crew were friendly. Santa spoke to each one of the children & there were a lot of them. Also liked that they had a warm place to wait before boarding the train.
Free museum to see and go inside trains. Seasonal train rides offered with a ticket purchase. Really neat place and great for the family!

name: Lake Overholser Park
address: 9398-9000 S Overholser Rd, Oklahoma City, OK 73127, USA
reviews: We like to go fish here sometimes as well. I like to walk around on the trails or on the dam! It’s usually kept pretty clean and it’s usually pretty quiet. Lots of people but not crowded at all. Plenty of parking all throughout the park. It's a great place to visit and get away from the everyday grind of business. It's one of my personal favorites! Lots of dog walking and we have an array of water fowl that pass through at varying times of the migratory year. This one is the big open area with trees and the soccer fields. Okay so of Sand bass used live Shad or live minnows only.  A wooden bridge across the pond. Lots of cleared land for flying kites or whatever you want to do! It's so beautiful and peaceful!
Stopped to walk around while passing through.  Beautiful park, no nice bathrooms though unless you're renting the place out. Portable toilets present though

This is a nice lake with an intermittent walking path, that varies between paved, dirt, and the road. I estimate the path to be somewhere under 10mi. The paved walking areas are very convenient and feel safe, when the paved area ends you have to share the road with the cars, who for the most part are courteous. There is varying amount of foot traffic depending on the time of the day, and a number of people fishing, but overall a quiet peace walk. There is an area that does rentals for  activities such as canoeing and the like.

It's always so beautiful to just drive around and park.  Very romantic especially when the moon is full and you find a good spot to see it reflect on the water and there are lights reflecting off it too.  We like to go fish here sometimes as well.
Fun place to sit quietly and meditate in places. Trails to walk, fishing all over, and theres a kids park and skate park on the west side. Good family fun for all.

name: Oklahoma Sports Hall of Fame
address: 20 S Mickey Mantle Dr, Oklahoma City, OK 73104, USA
reviews: I spent two hours here looking at exhibits and never saw everything it was awesome
There are a lot of really well curated areas honoring athletes from Oklahoma and elsewhere! It’s free, but has very little female representation.  Great views of the Chickasaw Bricktown Ballpark
I work at the Oklahoma Sports Hall of Fame and am uploading photos of the interior of the museum at the new location at the Chickasaw Bricktown Ballpark
Attended an event there wasn't impressed with the cleanliness.  Realizing they are remodeling but they still could have at least swept the stairs.  The wait staff were not very pleasant.
Veey awesome place to visit

name: Oklahoma State Capitol
address: 2300 N Lincoln Blvd, Oklahoma City, OK 73105, USA
reviews: Went here to present for a high school project. The artwork inside the building that lines the interior walls is a great tribute to the Tribes and their culture, as well as to the history of the state of Oklahoma. The place wasn't very crowded on the particular day I visited, and there was plenty of space to look around. I had the opportunity to sit in the Senate Chamber, which was also a cool experience to have. The people there were nice, and I'd definitely recommend visiting if you haven't already.

Building was under construction so couldn't see it all.  Front area wasn't the nicest.   There was an old oil tower right in the middle of the front view which kind of blocked it and didn't look nice.  Also big parking lots out for Senate etc....instead of park/grass/landscaping like many other Capitola have.  Inside was nice.  Cool dome and replica statue of dome topper.
The Oklahoma State Capitol is a nice place. You can spend nice time in front of the capitol building. There are plenty of parking spots here.
Even through the construction the building has plenty to see. Ralph is an affable and courteous tour guide. Thanks!!

Lots of renovations were going on while we were there. It was our first time so we didn't know what was new or old. We toured the chamber with our district's senator and sat in on a session. I reccomend it if you visit when session is available!

name: The American Pigeon Museum & Library
address: 2300 NE 63rd St, Oklahoma City, OK 73111, USA
reviews: Fantastic museum that really highlights how pigeons have served in the military and their accomplishments. Clean building, friendly staff, and adorable pigeons. (Pigeons were brought inside because of the rain and soon transported back to their home, normal cages are much larger). Excellent museum overall that is a great place for any pigeon or military enthusiast.
Am incredibly well kept and informative little museum. Much more than I expected
This is a very cool place to visit and learn about the American Pigeon.  What a great unique place to spend some time with your children.  Don't miss this OKC gem.
Very nice. Lots of information and pictures. Did not know the incredible story about the passenger pigions.

My friends and I had time to spare and came here. There is no entrance fee! We thought it would boring. It was actually really interesting! The live pigeons were off display temporarily, but they still made a way to allow us to see them. This place seems great for boy scouts, homeschoolers, history and war buffs, families, and animal lovers. I highly recommend this place. You won't regret coming here.

name: Lion's Children's Playground
address: 9050 Lake Hefner Pkwy, Oklahoma City, OK 73120, USA
reviews: So calming and fun things for kids and adults you can walk around, fish and play though I haven't been in a boat they also have those and much more I found a place a peace absolutely love it here

Why we are just now visiting the park by Lake Hefner, I have no idea. Sitting on the rocks by the lovely waves gave us a moment of peace and beauty that we appreciated so much! Thank you to those who keep this place clean - visitors/tourists like us really thank you. A nice park for families is nearby, and our restaurant was a short drive over. Perfect.
This is our go-to park. My kids love bringing a picnic or their kites out here and playing. Beautiful view of lake hefner.

I'm from Florida and when I go to OKC on business, Lake Hefner just let's me relax. The restaurants on the lake are good, the jogging path (short and long) are nice. You feel safe at the lake because of the nice people around there. I enjoy Lake Hefner.
Nice park for children located right on the water.

name: Oklahoma Contemporary Arts Center
address: 3000 General Pershing Blvd, Oklahoma City, OK 73107, USA
reviews: The exhibits here were top notch and the space itself is beautiful. Definitely worth a visit if you are in the Downtown Dallas area.
Once they move into their new downtown building this will be the art center to beat all others. I look forward to the amount of classes you can take, and multi-purpose artspace there will be!
Can't wait for this to open! Looking forward to taking some art classes here.
They hosted an art show and the place was SPOTLESS, not what you would expect from the state fair grounds. Loved it.

I came to Oklahoma Contemporary with my class at OCCC at we were there when Speak to Me was and it was amazing. The staff was really nice and knew their information and you can tell they enjoy what they do. I'm excited to go back and see new art sometime soon.

name: Saint Joseph's Old Cathedral
address: 307 NW 4th St, Oklahoma City, OK 73102, USA
reviews: Very Welcoming Church, nice service. They have a 4 pm Saturday Mass which is nice for travlers
Beautiful little Catholic Cathedral. Lovely stained glass and awesome Stations of the Cross. They have a nice bookstore on the lower level.
Beautiful Church.  Lovely service. Nice friendly people. Love it here!
We love the old Cathedral, we always make it a point to go when staying the weekend in OKC.
Beautiful, and welcoming. What a beautiful reverent celebration of the Mass. Really made this Texas girl happy even though I wasn't with my parish family back home 💜

name: E.C. Hafer Park
address: 1034 S Bryant Ave, Edmond, OK 73034, USA
reviews: Very nice, family friendly place. Plenty of play areas for the kids. The pond is very nice as well. It has a lot of geese and ducks there, all begging to be fed. The only downside is that the drinking water fountains were turned off. I understand that it was the middle of winter when I visited but Oklahoma winters can be pretty mild. It was quite warm that day so it would have been nice if they were on.

This place is an AWESOME place to spend a couple of hours or make a day out of it, especially with the kiddos.. My daughter loves it. They have 2 playgrounds, A duck pond with a pavilion that overlooks it with easy access to allow feeding the many hungry ducks. 
(DONT FORGET TO BRING BREAD OR CRACKERS !!!) The kids will love it.
There are clean public restrooms, picnic tables and benches to rest your legs after taking a nice walk on the walking path that wraps around it all. Pet friendly just don't forget your leash. Handicap parking & access to it all. 

So' what are you waiting on ? Put that device down, turn the TV off and come enjoy the park.. We will see you there.

This is one of my favorite parks and walking trails. I love that it doesn’t have the busy sounds of a road, and has sections that really pull you back into nature. The water element is perfect, and there are many great spots for hammocks to be set up, and to play ultimate frisbee, or simply bring a blanket and books and relax in nature.
Good place for barbecue and hiking. I went on January and it was still pretty, I cannot imagine how it will look during the spring. Definitely will be visiting again soon.

Serene and kept up well, this park was a nice change for my walk.  It was also nice to have varying rises and drops along the length of the path, while the path surface itself was mostly flat and even (unlike dirt paths at some other places I've walked).

name: Mat Hoffman Action Sports Park
address: 1700 S Robinson Ave, Oklahoma City, OK 73109, USA
reviews: Great time at this skatepark! We took our scooters and had a blast! The park has a lot of various skill level ramps, perfect for beginners or advanced.
Not too bad unless you're just starting out then I'd recommend another skate park. Bowl is good but limited lines and the "street course" is limited. It's pretty good.
Awesome park. Small flow for longboards. Only thing.. there’s glass EVERYWHERE. More a reason to not fall.. 😬😊

Of all the good action sports parks in the Metro, this one is my favorite. It always has very talented skaters and bikers and everyone is very kind to all ages of kids and levels of skill. Great place...well built. Always improving with new investments. Well maintained.
For those of you that like riding in bowls you would like this skate park.

name: Schilling Park
address: 601 SE 25th St, Oklahoma City, OK 73129, USA
reviews: Great clean park. It was a great place to meet up with community partners and volunteers alike for the national Sound the Alarm campaign that is led by the American Red Cross. This campaign has saved over 500 lives nations wide. Park was clean. Accessible, safe, and up to date. Kudos to Oklahoma Coty’s pars and recreation department for all that they do- this park (like many other city parks in Oklahoma City) was top notch.
It's peaceful nobody's there to cause any problems my family love it.
It's really nice out here today and my daughter is enjoying yourself..
Love this park! Several different things the kids could. Plus very private at night.
They are adding so many new things ...hope it turns out amazing

name: Andy Alligator's Fun Park & Water Park
address: 3300 Market Pl, Norman, OK 73072, USA
reviews: We went for my grandsons birthday and had as great time! He loved the miniature golf and loved watching his grandmother climb the rock wall!!🤣 We rode the go carts and played tons of video games. I had fun bowling with my niece and playing air hockey while they kids did laser tag. The food was mediocre but the staff were amazing.

This is our second time coming here for birthday parties and both times our host was Ariel. She was awesome! She made our experience amazing! She is amazing with the kids as well! I loved it both times and would love to come back again. Thank you so much!

We were greeted by Marc when we arrived. He was so informative and showed us around the whole place. My kids were fully informed on all the exciting options before they picked which fun things they wanted to do. We had a blast as a family. We look forward to coming back!

Well how to even start this review.. This Sunday 01/05/2020 me and my family went to have a Sunday funday, and this was not the place to go for that. we wasn't there that long because of how some of the employees were treating some of their customs. I'm a business man  my self and i believe in treating your customers with respect. My family was playing in the arcade and i was out at the go carts watch a couple kids go around the track. the go karts are slow and the kids were probably around 7 to 8. In the middle of the race they stopped the go karts told the kids they were kick off for the rest of the day. the father got upset and I got confused.  they might have bumped a little but nothing crazy (i was actually videoing so i could  show my wife they wasn't that fast and i didn't see how our kids could hurt them selves) went on about my business  to go show my wife and there was a commotion with the father and the manager about the incident. Apparently because the go karts bumped each other they weren't able to ride and were ban from the karts. and really that's what most people enjoy the most. instead of the business making them take a break and explain to the kids what they did wrong the straight kicked them off. i could see the fathers point of view and instead of the manager  trying to talk civil to their customer she was actually pretty rude. after the incident the father left the i over heard the manager and some long haired guy speaking to each other saying something about they didn't belong there or even in the country! I guess its because they were Spanish or some other race! I grabbed my kids and  wife and left!!! This isn't  what the world needs right now at this moment with everything going on! Being the manager of a place means doing whats right and what they did on this day was very wrong! I will not be going back to this place because of the lack of training of employees and the racist comments made!

We will not return. We came for a birthday party. The kids get cards to play the games with, and these cards retain your ticket balance for prizes later. When we went to do my sons, no problem, and he had 3 tickets left. My daughter wanted his 3 tickets. The guy tried to combine the cards. He deleted them. She had over 540 tickets. He wouldn’t do anything about it. Nothing. Needless to say, I left there with a crying 8 year old, $200 out of my pocket spent on top of what they spent on the party, and then treated like crooks. Never again!

name: Arcadia Round Barn
address: 107 OK-66, Arcadia, OK 73007, USA
reviews:
We took our son and daughter-in-law from Charlotte, NC here today before dropping them off at the airport. Great visit for everyone in the family, even those of us who had been here before. So cool to stand in the middle of the barn and near the cool acoustic effects. Weekend music sessions must be great to listen to. 
Enjoyed wandering the souvenir shop below and learning about the history of this unique attraction. Even picked up an ornament for the Christmas tree this time around. 
Staff was friendly and informative. Definitely recommended taking the time to stop by when in the area.

We take weekend road trips and decided to go  to Arcadia to see the round barn.
Believe me, if you are a history buff, this is a great day trip to take. Not only is the round barn very interesting but it is filled with amazing pieces of history and information. They also have some nice items for sale.
It was well worth the drive.
This is such a fun place to stop and a must-see Route 66 landmark if you are interested in that kind of thing. The barn itself is beautiful, especially the upper level.
Interesting place, very cool to take the kids when driving by.   The echo is awesome.  Not a lot of interesting items in the gift shop but that's ok.
Very cool to see. Great music being played live. Worth checking out.

name: Bluff Creek Park
address: N Meridian Ave, Oklahoma City, OK 73162, USA
reviews: This park is well worth our 20 min commute from Midwest City OK. We recently got a dog from an animal center and have been looking for parks all over Oklahoma City. This park is animal friendly with trash locations and bags. There are two main trails. One on concrete which we walked on, but there’s also one for mountain bikes. That one goes through the trees and around the creek and really is unique looking. I did see people running and walking on that trail too if you prefer curves rather than a big pavement trail. There is also a wetland area on the NW side where my dog jumped in for a swim. Definitely would recommend and maybe you’ll be lucky and spot deer. We saw 3 good size ones just jumping across the trail.

Truly a great park for anything outdoors. I typically utilize the bike trails here and they are always a great time. The trails are just technical and long enough to make this a really fun ride the whole time. The park itself is always clean and seems well taken care of. Love coming out here to enjoy my weekends.

This park is large, quiet, and pretty. There is a port-o-potty in the parking lot, lots of running/walking trails, and a family-friendly playground. There are also trashcans placed throughout the park and it is very clean. Dog-friendly (with leash) as well! Love coming here

They have a lite workout on one of the trails, walking AND bicycle trails. We saw deer!!!! Nice & clean. My only concern was the portapotty in front of the bridge has a broken lock, the winds keep blowing the door open.
Great walking and dirt biking trails. Duck ponds towards the back. If you go in the late afternoon, deer will walk almost up to you.

name: Stars and Stripes Park
address: 3701 S Lake Hefner Dr, Oklahoma City, OK 73116, USA
reviews: I like this spot! There were a lot of people out and about today due to the beautiful weather. People with their kids, out walking dogs, bike riding... But we humans are messy creatures!! The trash cans were at capacity so there was trash on the ground around the trash cans. But that's not the parks fault! Get outside. Enjoy the day. And do all that stuff at this park.

I posted a picture of the rocket ship that was there in the 70s when I grew up. It was huge, all metal, and with multiple sections. Many times it was with fear that I did, or did not, go down the curvy side. 
The sounds of footfalls on the textured metal ramps, with the wire mesh fence jangling, gravel being pushed around and doing its own slide, and of course high-pitched voices in playground ecstasy. Definitely the best toy of my childhood. (MAYBE the minibike, well, bicycle, too). 
Love the setting of Stars and Stripes park, too- at least Lake Hefner is still there! Beautiful.

There are many features to Stars and Stripes park. Firstly, there are multiple large playground equipment pieces. They are suited to various ranges of children 2-12. The park uses those wood chips as "impact material" so no sand. There are also 6 swings and 2 baby swings. So for a playground, it is well stocked. 
     There is ample parking as well as handicapped parking and access.  Binges provide lots of seating for supervising the children as well as stopping along the sidewalk. There are public bathrooms in the brick pavilion as well as multiple porta-potties. There are many concrete picnic tables and grills. The pavilion is covered, and there are a couple other covered picnic tables also. There are lights spread throughout the park.
     Aside from the playground equipment, there is also a basketball half-court. They installed a fitness section which has built-in equipment to do various exercises such as lunges, box jumps, speed drills, and pushing and pulling exercises. They have also added a skate park, with a large bowl and a few ramps, stairs, and railings.

They always host Puggerfest here in October and boy it's so much fun. With food trucks and lots of cute puggy faces to love on. Never disappointed and the lake view is really nice! The park is kept clean and tidy and even for a park bathroom I have seem worse
Beautiful in summer, quiet in winter. Good place for small children. Converted pavilion for parties and picnic tables with charcoal grills for chilling.

name: 99's Museum of Women Pilots
address: 4300 Amelia Earhart Ln Drive, Oklahoma City, OK 73159, USA
reviews: Truly a gem of an aviation museum a short walk away from Tulsa International airport.  Not very well known, but so very worth the visit. Small but interesting gift shop. The office personnel down stairs will open up the museum upstairs and it's a self guided tour through many well documented display case. Entire history of women's aviation is covered. A must visit stop for all history buffs and aviation enthusiast

The museum was very interesting. It contained many photos, newspaper clippings, articles, and artifacts honoring women in aviation. It gave the history of the 99s organization from its beginning to the present time, and detailed their story of how and why these brave women started the renowned 99s group. I would recommend a visit to the museum to those living in Oklahoma and anyone who loves to fly.
Incredible hidden gem. Tells the story of a cheeky group who could've been rivals, but instead decided to uplift one another. Feminists, take note.
Love the museum. Has really changed over past 1-2years. Got to see, a gem.

Very nice museum. If you are ever flying in or out of will Rogers, give yourself 30-40 minutes to stop in an see all the displays. Follows women flying since the 1920's up to early 2000's. Very good write ups in the display, especially the air race.

name: Hefner Park
address: 3301 NW Grand Blvd, Oklahoma City, OK 73116, USA
reviews: This park has beautiful views and today it was 58° and somewhat windy. Lots of birds to see, many of which were huddled together like friends, even though they were different kinds of birds. I thought that was pretty cool.😎 Enjoyed walking the well maintained trails. My only complaint would be that someone in the city needs to empty the trashcans. They were all full. 😕
Great park we all have a moral responsibility to help keep our local parks clean. Do your part and help by simply cleaning up after yourself ppl!
Great views and restaurants.  New to oklahoma?  Trails walk dogs ride bikes this is a really cool local OKC area
Basketball court and plenty of room the basketball ball goals need work though
So beautiful, a great place for the family!

name: Regatta Park
address: 701 S Lincoln Blvd, Oklahoma City, OK 73129, USA
reviews: Great place to take a break from life and take a walk around a clean lake scattered with wild life.

I love working out at this place!  The boat tours look super fun but I'm all about the calisthenics parks!  Overall  it's a great place to spend a day!  Dont forget the checkout all the boathouse district has to offer, child friendly clean fun and a little.more thrill than your probably used to!
Very beautiful River and I like to walk around the river. Sometimes I come here to get extra refreshment. Really I enjoy here!
Maybe I was lucky but when I went I was the only person there. It was lovely.
Beautiful place. The surrounding is well maintained. People usually love the walk around the lake. Also the boat house have facility to accomodate small get-together and events.

name: Ride OKC
address: 152 S Walker Ave, Oklahoma City, OK 73102, USA
reviews: We did the breweries tour.  It was a fun experience.  Ryan, our guide was knowledgeable, friendly, and safe.  He gave us a briefing on road rules, etiquette, the law and tips on making it a fun and safe ride event.  I would  highly recommend this tour.  We even got interesting information on what buildings were and saw some architectural gems!  We plan to comeback.  So much fun!  Thank you!
I’ve been on three rides with Ryan. Very entertaining and knowledgeable. If you live in, move to, or visit OKC, this is a great way to get to know the City.

We had a great time doing the brewery bike ride. Along the way Ryan (the guide) gave us insight on architecture and some history of downtown OKC. I would recommend this to anyone! We had a blast and we definitely will be doing another tour.

My mom was in town from Southern California and I was looking for something to do. We found RideOKC and it couldn’t have been any better. Ryan was our tour guide for the Art & Architecture Tour. What a wonderful way to see OKC and learn about it’s incredible history. I will definitely be biking with BikeOKC again for some of their other tours. You won’t be disappointed with this Tour Company! Ryan even took photos of our group. He is very knowledgeable about the history of OKC.

Everything about this tour was great. Our guide, Ryan, was knowledgeable, friendly, and experienced. It was just my husband & I on our tour, so he even changed the route to take us to a place we hadn't been. The meeting place was easy to find & the ride was easy. I definitely recommend this tour company & the craft brew tour!

name: Oklahoma Hall of Fame
address: 1400 Classen Dr, Oklahoma City, OK 73106, USA
reviews:
Absolutely beautiful historic building with a wonderful collection representing Oklahomans who have contributed to the betterment of the world in a variety of capacities from sports, entertainment, civil rights, medicine, education & business. 

Every inductee has their portrait or picture somewhere throughout the museum with their name, City & general contribution plus the year inducted into the Oklahoma Hall Of Fame. I think an added touch would be a longer synopsis of what each person did in more detail but I’m the curious type of person that will look them up to find out more information 👍🏻

There is an art gallery where the artist exhibits rotate periodically. The current exhibit “Spirit Of Color”, just started and runs to April 30th, 2020. Beautiful art that you can contact the museum about purchasing the items. 

Originally built in 1926 for the Mid-Continental Life Insurance Company. I love that every door handle still contains the Mid-Continental emblem. The building is absolutely gorgeous, grand staircases on every floor & marble everywhere! You can even rent the location for private events & weddings. Unique venue with lots of beautiful photo opportunities. 

This was my second time here. It’s a nice way to spend an hour or two browsing around.
Great and relatively cheap. A little less exciting since its mostly portraits, but there are more interactive and engaging videos and a little play area for younger visitors.
it was great. they had Christmas activities for the kids. I enjoyed walking viewING all the great history about Oklahoma. I will visit again next year.
It was very facinating and interesting to see the people who arose from Oklahoma.
Friendly nice place my kids love the event

name: Red Earth
address: 100 N Broadway Ave # 2750, Oklahoma City, OK 73102, USA
reviews: Simply breathtaking home for the Native American art. Lots to look at such as paintings and pottery. The Red Earth company is located in downtown Oklahoma City and the staff is very welcoming. Plus you have access to the underground just a few feet away.
The Treefest exhibit is visually appealing. The trees tell about the traditions of each tribe. Highly recommend.

I've not been there yet but the red earth pow wows are always amazing. Hoe ever I drove 2 and 1/2 hours to find out there not open because there doing some work. Wish they would have said not open since there not
"Great Native American Art Gallery"  a must see ! Many art items you can buy.

My husband and I took our kiddos to see all the Christmas trees from different Native American tribes in Oklahoma. It was great for our kids to read a description of each tree and why they chose the specific ornaments to decorate with. Highly recommend checking it out.

name: Dolese Youth Park
address: 5105 NW 50th St, Oklahoma City, OK 73112, USA
reviews: Beautiful park for a diva golf course with well-marked stations and a handful of elevated baskets, making the play for interesting. There will be a handful of baskets near to the pond and major roads, adding another level of interest. There are two different courses on site if you are up for two rounds of 18-holes. For a break, there is a shaded area near the parking lot closer to NW 57th Street. You enter the park from NW 50th Street and the road will lead you pass the pond and a baseball field.
Love this place everytime we go. Kids have so much fun and the adults get to play games too!
Beautiful baseball facility! Fields are lovingly manicured, staff friendly and welcoming.  Great first impression.

Most rate this course a 5 I suppose.  The insane mosquito population here, especially in the densely wooded areas annihilates my ability to focus when throwing.  Otherwise such a variety of holes to throw and during off (skeeter) season it's probably the best option to throw at after heavy rains make most other parks overly muddy.  The 'island' at the start is mostly sand.
Great place I am a official for baseball and did the varsity teams two games, Lawton Vs  Grant.

name: Milk Bottle Grocery
address: 2426 N Classen Blvd, Oklahoma City, OK 73106, USA
reviews: this is very cool! really enjoy seeing things like this! the gold dome shaped areana was also very cool, and really enjoyed the veteran's war memorial as well!
A storic insign of an old grocery, now one of the Oklahoma city symbols. Nice spot just for some pics.
Another cool photo op
Currently an architecture office so it's not in to the public. Exterior is a unique triangle building planted in the middle of an intersection.

When my family first moved to Oklahoma in 1941we rented a room not far from here. This building was then a place where you could buy magazines, newspapers, ice cream treats and pop. There was a playground behind the store then and my mother and I would go to the store for Eskimo pies then to the park. Very fond memories for me.

name: South Lakes Park
address: 4210 SW 119th St, Oklahoma City, OK 73173, USA
reviews:
Fantastic public venue. The public event center is available for semi-formal events and fundraisers.  It is an older facility, but maintained enough to be functional. The size of the park is significant.  The playgrounds are great. Lots of fun for older and younger kids. 

Public field can host a large outdoor event.
 
Soccer club promotes lots of activities.

The walking trail is less crowded than Hefner or some other high traffic public venues.

I like this park a lot. Its a nice space to walk your dogs, watch ducks, let the kids play etc., The play ground has two play "areas" one for smaller kids and one that's for kids a little older.
