The only downside is how many people don't pick up their dog's waste.  Its not that hard! Also, the people that go on walks and don't have their dog leashed.

Excellent Park in OKC. It has everything you could ask for in a park. Soccer fields, Playgrounds, walking paths, fishing ponds, and a skate Park. The playground is a little dated but there is plenty variety. Kids of all ages can enjoy it. Definitely recommend it for the whole family.
Fun place , good atmosphere. Descent fishing spot

This is a really safe secure and dog friendly park. Me and my wife come here either every morning or at night before they close. At this point there is some green Algae on the water so don't let your dogs drink it or they could dehydrate to death. But this stuff is on a lot of body's of water right now not just here. And if you are going early or at night I would suggest bringing a flash light for safety at night around the long end of the tracks for there are no lights.

name: Eldon Lyon Park
address: 7400 NW 36th St, Bethany, OK 73008, USA
reviews: Clean park with restrooms and plenty of trash cans. Nice basketball court and play ground for kids.  Plus they also host a great 4 of July celebration every year.  Go here and have a fun day!
Love how it has a perfect circle to walk around and how it is marked how far you've gone
Great park, concrete walking path, swimming pool, tennis courts, basketball court, little kids play ground. Just a great park.!!
Best place to walk! Smooth sidewalks, a little elevation at times...and the trees are super cool.
Great park with a 2 mile walking path around it. Trees provide good shade in the morning.

name: North Pole Adventure
address: 2215 W W Interstate 240 Service Rd, Oklahoma City, OK 73159, USA
reviews:
The kids love it, what else matters? It hasn't been the same since moving out of Cross Roads... This year was a big improvement. Real reindeer are back and the kids loved shooting the Grinch with nerf guns.

2 stars because our tickets, which were purchased through ticket storm, had the wrong address. We ended up in the middle of nowhere, and when we called the OWNER he laughed. He acted like we were lying, said he's sold over 4,000 tickets and that's never happened. I don't care how many tickets you've sold, mine had the wrong address.

Would be 4 stars if the owner would have shown a little professionalism. 5 stars if the storage area leading to the restrooms didn't smell like an ashtray. Smoke outside.
Family fun night was great North Pole adventures. My kids loved the snow room and of course the reindeer. I think it's definitely worth the money.

This magical place has lost some spark over the last few years. 2019 was our 3rd time going, we missed 2018 so not sure of that's when they moved again, but we loved this place so much that we were so excited to go again and share this experience with our 11 kid visitors from out of state. Unfortunately so much has changed that its lost a lot of his warm and inviting atmosphere. The computer letters were really disappointing because christmas is all about that letter to santa and the little kids were unable to engage in that activity at all. At least with letters they can write their name or scribble their cute little version of a note to the special man. I love that the santa hasn't changed but the scene was dark and the picture quality was a joke this season. 
The best part was by far mrs clause who was so warm, friendly and inviting. Unfortunately the only other staff that could be  classified that way was the Santa workshop elves who also did Amazing. The kids all got a stuffed animal to keep this year that they 'made' with the elf. I do kind of miss how yall did it in previous years because it gave the kids a little taste of Christmas and sharing that magic with other kids by donating it. I think this was a way of cutting cost because they used to have a wooden toy you made with the elves and a stuffed animal you made for charity but this year was only the stuffed animal. 
 I would honestly give 2 stars if it werent for the fact that I've been previous years and it was amazing those times. I'm not sure if my family will go back next year just because it wasnt as friendly as it used to be. It used to be my favorite thing about the season hitting. I loved the wood floors like we were walking into an actual village/workshop and loved the explanation of the reindeers, yall just got rid of too many of the amazing things you used to have. 
I've added 2 screenshots of pictures from 2016 to show what it used to be. Now it's just a maze in a warehouse with little to no elf involvement umlike previous years.

We have been coming here for a few years now and have always enjoyed it. However,this year we have a new baby and had to pay full price for her. She is 9 months old and the lady at the register told me only 7 months and under are free. I thought this was absolutely ridiculous. She sat in her stroller the entire time. And why 7 months and under? Makes no sense. I've never been anywhere in my life that made you pay for a baby. If it weren't for my other kids we would have left. This will be our last year attending.

My baby still believes in Santa because of this place!!!    We have been going to the North pole for Years!  Santa is always nice and jolly, Mrs Clause always has hot fresh cookies and there are Real reindeer walking around doing reindeer stuff.   The Elves looked a bit exhausted,  but all in all a great place to take kids .  They make a toy and play in snow too.    Wish they had a train.   Bring your wallet,  it's not cheap.

name: Edmond Dog Park at Bickham-Rudkin Park
address: 379 E 33rd St, Edmond, OK 73013, USA
reviews: Nice dog park but lots of dogs$$t all over.  Should have volunteers to take care of it.  You  should know that the lake area is NOT fenced in so when you go out the  gate your dog can run like hell. If not for the lack of pickup by dog owners would be 5 star.

We stopped at this dog park on our way through Oklahoma on a road trip and our dogs loved it! It’s well-kept inside the park and it has a gate out to the lake area. I don’t believe the lake area is fully-fenced so you have to keep an eye on the doggos if they are walking the shore (but both of our dogs are off-leash trained so it didn’t make any difference to us). There is running water to full dishes and some obstacles to play on. We will definitely be stopping here again!

My babies loved to play here. You feel apart of the community as soon as you walk into it. The lake is a perfect addition and the girls made new friends and so did we. It is a place to connect and have fun and the facilities are perfect. Its large enough for your first babies to run as much as they want. The water bowl in the middle is perfect placement as there is so much going on that it is nice to have a designated place for them to drink. I appreciate this place so much.

Great dog park. It's huge, and very well designed. Concrete slabs with drains and pumps for the water, so there's no mud puddle, and flagstones around the trashcans so they don't turn into a morass either. I will definitely be back.
Everyone there was friendly and attentive to their pups! Grassy but also muddy on wet days! I think it's a great and active dog park! Great for socializing your pup since the dogs are so friendly!

name: Stinchcomb Wildlife Refuge
address: Yukon, OK 73099, USA
reviews: Nice for a January 90-minute stroll (no leaves, and everything's dormant, but no bugs or heat either ☺️). Saw an armadillo, and lots of birds. Peaceful. Birds chirping and sun sparkling on the water. Wear shoes you don't mind getting muddy and bring a bag to put them in after, and a change of shoes. Then you can explore all the nice little trails through the woods and you don't need to go on the road at all. Good to get away from buildings and roads for a while, get some fresh air, and clamber over (and on) fallen trees.

Our favorite local nature escape. Lots of area to explore if you're willing to venture off the road. Heartbreaking to see trees damaged by hatchet-happy hikers. Extremely helpful to have topography GPS when exploring off the main road. A few good places to relax and enjoy a fire by the river.

Used to like going down river to cast net. Bait for the lake. Now according to the game ranger they changed that. It's now pole fishing only all the way to the power plant. Still a fun place. Sometimes there's a few weird people that find their way down there. So stay aware.

a place where I like to come to relax with my family and take some photos of Nature; away from the noise of the City, crossing Stinchcomb Wildlife Refuge is the best, you can take from 2:45 to 3:00 hours to cross if you stop to eat a sandwich and enjoy nature, I love it, I recommend it 100%

I go to shinchcomb often and every time it surprises Mee with dense forests where you might find yourselves in the midgest of birds with all the funny activies(off the trail) swarps and walking with the flow of river with best sunsets and sunrises, with wildlife and today I saw an otter in my life, stars.✌️🧐😁

name: Pat Murphy Park
address: 4500 W Hefner Rd, Oklahoma City, OK 73162, USA
reviews:
This is a wonderful park for the entire family! There are separate play structures. One is for children ages 2 to 5 The other is for ages 5 to 12. They also have a wonderful percussion music section which is basically indestructible. There are four swings, two for babies and two for older kids. There are a couple covered picnic tables as well as a few more stone picnic tables out in the open. There are multiple benches to sit and watch your children play. 
There's good parking with a couple of handicap spots as well as a bicycle repair stand. There are automatic lights that light up the parking lot, but not the playground itself.  The playground is wheelchair accessible, but the equipment is not. There is also an open field next to the park where people play cricket and other sports.

There are no public restrooms.

By far one of our favorite spots for a beautiful day!  Opportunities for big and small kids to play.  From an assortment of slides, balancing activities, to even musical instruments. This park has it all.  There is covered picnic areas, restrooms as well as plenty of shade.

Pros:
1. Clean
2. Walk and bike path
3. Dog friendly
4. Not too crowded
5. Play area for kids
6. Good amount of parking
7. Good amount of space
8. Wild deer

Cons:
N/A
Nice park for kids and adults. Great trees for hammocking too. They have nice hiking trails and picnic areas, plus a covered pavilion.
So much to do! The kids loved the drum and bells part.

name: Wheeler Park
address: 1120 S Western Ave, Oklahoma City, OK 73108, USA
reviews: This park is so beautiful. I recommend riding the ferris wheel and checking out the food trucks.

So much fun! Great place to go if you like relaxing walks or even if you wanna laze around they have hammocks! Pet friendly and fun fun fun! The ferris wheel has an amazing view and so does the whole trail! Could walk for miles and not get bored of the view! Love this park!

Wheeler park is interesting. 

On one hand it's kind of out in this random area all by itself, with no substantial trees and feels kind of desolate a lot of the time. 

On the other hand, it has a great view of downtown, the giant OKC is cool for taking pictures, the Ferris wheel is fun and has great views and if you go here with a bunch of people this is a pretty cool spot. 

The context in which you visit this place will greatly color your experience and opinion of this place in my experience. 

This is a good place to host a work event or party. 

Overall, pretty cool and worth checking out. I'd recommend going when other people will be here, like evenings, especially on the the weekend.

Very nice place, we enjoy going there to kick back enjoy the hammocks, swings, usually food trucks and especially the ferris wheel from Santa Monica Beach right on the bank of the Oklahoma River day or night is nice.
Lots of space. Play ground, kite flying space, good parking, concrete path, bench seating, etc.

name: Buck Thomas Park
address: 1903 NE 12th St, Moore, OK 73160, USA
reviews: Hands-down our favorite place to play softball. Best facilities by far and breakfast served by concession stands on tournament mornings is incredible. Youth baseball fields are great areas for skateboarding walking or jogging soccer fields and everyone is always friendly. Whether you have children or not you need to check Buck Thomas Park out.

The family and I love this park. Plenty of stuff to do for all ages.
The only  thing I do not like about this park is, the people who drive through the park. They just fly through the parking lot. Like hello our kids are playing. Definitely needs bigger speed bumps, to slow people down.
Nice playgrounds and ball fields, good place to run around too if you like jogging.
Great baseball fields, paved walking paths, very convenient, and a nice little skatepark. Worth a visit if you are close.
This has always been one of the better ball parks in the OKC metro area for little league baseball..

name: Individual Artists of Oklahoma
address: 706 W Sheridan Ave, Oklahoma City, OK 73102, USA
reviews: If you like art the you need to make it a point to visit. IAO put together some of the best art shows in the city.

I've been here for a couple of events and decided to have my wedding/reception here. It is the best wedding venue. Reasonably priced. There's art so not much extra decorating to do, and they had all of the tables and chairs we needed. Everyone was super helpful and accommodating.
Great place to see an be involved with local art and artist
Very nice venue for a fundraiser!
I went to a fiber arts show there. A great display of diverse works. Very interesting pieces.

name: Oklahoma City's Adventure District
address: 1 Remington Pl, Oklahoma City, OK 73111, USA
reviews: Love the Southside having more things for locals to do

name: McKinley Park
address: 1398 NW 13th St, Oklahoma City, OK 73106, USA
reviews: It's a great place, to meet up with friends that have kids. So they can play together! The community center is a really nice place for kids after school!
Needs more outdoor facilities, like a water fountain and bathrooms. I might have missed them but didn't see it.
Fun is the word for me at this park even running around as long as you're moving
I Live next door to it! Wonderful for soccer, basketball, running & walking. Great Water park & playground. Indoor gym & other activities.
Nice. Splash pad, playground, pavillion for picnic. Historic structures closed or closed for season. Maybe WPA or CCC

name: OOZIE Mediterranean Restaurant
address: 1211 N Shartel Ave STE 102, Oklahoma City, OK 73103, USA
reviews: I’ve pretty much tried all the Mediterranean restaurants in OKC and this is undoubtedly the best I’ve had. Starting from the ambience to the service, hygiene... it’s all great. The food tastes awesome and portions are huge. Charlie the owner and his family are awesome human beings and creates a very friendly and warm environment. If you’re looking for good and quality food, this is the place to go!!!
Great food!  Picture is the Hashwa Plate Special and comes with a drink.

I just found this place, and you should too. Traditional Lebanese dishes as well as American. Small place, don't expect big, and without adult beverage service at this time. But the owner, Charlie has a ready smile, and is very accommodating.  If you can
...support he and his family. Once you try it....you'll return!
Excellent Mediterranean food. I could not find the restaurant at first. Then I realized it’s inside this building on the 1st floor. Staff is very friendly. Place is clean and bright. Priced right.
This place was good, I got the chicken shawarma

name: Cheever's Cafe
address: 2409 N Hudson Ave, Oklahoma City, OK 73103, USA
reviews: The chicken salad with fruit was very good. Excellent service every time. The ice cream ball is beyond wonderful, and it's complementary if it's your birthday! It can get noisy when it's really busy, so go at slower times if that's a concern for you.

Celebrated our wedding anniversary here and had a great time. Food was delicious, must try the chicken fried steak, best I've ever had. The portions were large, my wife and I shared one serving. The waiter Will was awesome and made the night very enjoyable.

Excellent experience from the time we got there until the time we left. Very prompt attention and Service from the minute we walked through the door. The hostess was very pleasant and greeted us immediately. The waitress was very attentive and accurate. The food was amazing from the first bite until the last. My wife and I both tried the chicken fried steak and I cannot even express in words how amazing it was. 5 stars +. Cannot wait to go back!

Brandy was absolutely amazing! It was a beautiful day so my cousin and I enjoyed the patio tables. They were accommodating with us bringing a dog. Everyone who worked there was very pleasant. I was happy to eat there and will be telling my friends.

I will say this, this is a cool place to eat. Service was amazing and the food was very good. The chicken fry was really good. You get two mind you and it w fill you up. The steak was great as the veggies and pico were awesome. You must save room for the chocolates cake as that will finish you lunch or dinner off with a smile. The decor was very cool too. An old flower shop that was owned by a local family. The details are on the menu so take time to read the history. Will be back.

name: Charleston's Restaurant
address: 2000 S Meridian Ave, Oklahoma City, OK 73108, USA
reviews: Fresh food. Great taste. Good quantities. Amazing salads. Excellent service. I honestly can't think of a single negative thing about my visit here. I don't think you could go wrong with anything on the menu. They were very accommodating to dietary requirements, too!

Absolutely amazing! Everything was just about perfect! It was clean. The wait-staff was very attentive. The food was beyond delicious. I honestly don't have one criticism about any of it. I had an excellent experience and would definitely make this a priority dinner stop in the future! Highly recommended!

Absolutely fabulous from the time we walked in the door! Greeted with a smile, seated right away at a very clean table with menus. Our server came over right away for drink orders, then promptly brought them & took our order. The marinated rib eye was the best I've ever had! The salad was fresh & had everything including my favorite dressing. The croissant served with salad was divine!  Even though full from dinner, it was my husband's birthday so we got the Apple cobbler a la mode❤
I can't say enough positive things about Charleston's. Definitely will be back!

Our server was great.
Food was good. 
They sat five of us at a small table. Barely room for food and drinks. A few times we had staff literally reach between my husband and his plate to deliver drinks, without warning. Spilled some on him.  Hoping they were new staff and training in their near future.

We visited while on a business trip and were pleasantly surprised. Definitely lived up to the high reviews. Drinks were good, the shaved roast beef on the French Dip was perfectly pink and added great flavor. It was a little pricier than we thought but was worth it.

name: The Mule
address: 1630 N Blackwelder Ave, Oklahoma City, OK 73106, USA
reviews: Fantastic sandwiches! Grilled cheese are my all time favorite and theirs are absolutely delicious. My kids love the mac and cheese too. Everything in this store is inviting, really great place for some comfort food. Will definitely come back for more!

The reviews were good for the Mule so decided to try it for lunch since I was in the area for the day. It's a rustic little joint but food was delicious. Chose the special of the day, the Rowdy Cowboy which was brisket & bacon in a very cheesy cheese sandwich with onion rings. I would go back in a heartbeat!

Good spot well hidden in OKC.  Known for good vibes and soled drinks, this place is worth a stop.
The menu is well thought out.
Great service. Wonderful bar and the bartender (Josh) is awesome. Soup and salad were great too! I'll be back on my next visit! Looking forward to trying a new cocktail next time too!

Absolutely great service, different hipster kind of atmosphere or frequenters anyhow. Easy parking for customers. Always busy but they take care of you timely. 10/10 would recommend on cleanliness, friendliness, quality, choices, pricing. Everything here is a win. If you needed a review to decide, you've taken entirely to long to get in here, go now!

name: Whiskey Cake Kitchen & Bar
address: 1845 Northwest Expy, Oklahoma City, OK 73118, USA
reviews: Great food and even better cocktails! I like that the menu changes up a bit depending on the season, and the cocktails are fun and unique. The bill can rack up quick if you aren't paying attention, but if you're go in prepared for that, it is a nice experience. The service is always great. Sunday brunch has a fun build your own bloody Mary bar. And you have to end your meal with a whiskey cake for the table, because celebratory reasons aside, it's in the name!

Love this place! The food is as farm to table as it gets. They have locally grown suppliers so their menu is seasonal and always changing. Their cocktails are phenomenal! The cheese board had been excellent and unique every time. But the deviled eggs..... always amazing!

The food was delicious, I just think it's overpriced.  The atmosphere was pleasant, industrial/farmhouse simple, we were there for early afternoon, I bet night time is the right time.  We ordered the deviled eggs.  I really enjoyed their take/presentation on a classic picnic food (fresh basil/salami).  I had a burger.  It was a little too much bun, and the cheese was rich, but great flavor.  My husband ordered their chicken and waffles... that had an interesting flavor, bacon in the waffle batter, and a rich gravy over the chicken.  My absolute favorite was the Whiskey Cake recommended by our hostess.  Fresh whipped cream, vanilla ice cream with sponge cake soaked in bourbon and caramel topped with pecans.

Celebration of a promotion in the family. Start with the deviled eggs, it's a must! My daughter and I shared the pickled Rachel and the three little pigs (BBQ pork sliders). We loved them both! Our table also had the switch up and the double double. The chips are seasoned to perfection. Everything we had was super delicious. The staff was delightful from the time we walked in the door. The server was wonderful and it was just an overall great experience.

My second time here in a week.  Both times the food was really good. Not sure if Whiskey Cake is a chain, if so this place he feels so unique like it’s one of its own kind. I had the Turkey burger with a side of the blackened Broccoli with cashews and Parmesan, the second time I had the Pastrami sandwich with the blackened Broccoli, and my daughter and I shared their Whiskey Cake for dessert. Ran into a minor issue the first visit and the Managing Partner (Robert) took care of us. The staff is knowledgeable and pleasant. Ten for ten will patronize Whiskey Cake again. Thanks Robert and team.

name: Red PrimeSteak
address: 504 N Broadway Ave, Oklahoma City, OK 73102, USA
reviews: Great place to eat! A+ atmosphere A+ food and A+ service. The entire staff takes great care of you! Brooklyn does a great job of waiting on you! She explained the menu and options to a tee! Highly recommended place!!!

We absolutely LOVE red prime! It's a little on the pricey side- (you get what you pay for!) so we only get to go a few times a year for special occasions. They never fail to disappoint! The wait staff is always very attentive and the food always comes out perfect. The prix fixe menu is a good deal, and so so much food! Try the chop house salad you won't regret it!

Hands Down The Best Steak In Town! 
If you want one of the best steaks in Oklahoma City, come here! It is on the high end as far as price but it is worth splurging once and a steak cooked to perfection. Highly Recommend this place!

Best steak my wife and I have had in a long long time! I took her here for New Year's Eve. We will definitely be back in the future! Be prepared, it is a little pricey but, the food is to die for and absolutely worth the price! The wait staff was amazing and very helpful as well as very attentive. The bartenders had good conversation and amazing drinks while we waited on our table. Highly recommend for a nice date night, I also recommend getting a private booth if you're going on a date, it made the evening that much better!
We had Jason as our server. He was top notch and and super friendly guy. The food was pretty good as well. Not a bad place honestly. The blue crab lump crab meat was super good.

name: Redrock Canyon Grill
address: 9221 Lake Hefner Pkwy, Oklahoma City, OK 73120, USA
reviews: This place is absolutely fantastic! Not only was the food absolutely to die for, I CAN NOT emphasize the phenomenal service my family and I received, enough! It was completely packed due to it being Valentine's Day but they never wavered. One hostess even showed my mom to the restroom despite of how busy it was. Mason was not only very knowledgeable, he was friendly and welcoming. Three service team works together to make sure you have everything you need, regardless if you're they're table or not. Our food arrived at our table quickly and it was delicious. The atmosphere and the ambiance along with the lakeside view are superb! I would highly recommend this location to any and everyone!

1st time visitor. Got the pork chops as is from the menu. I requested well done. It was done well, not dried out, not tough. Completely done and still juicy, very flavorful. It came with mashed potatoes and whole green beans. The worst thing on the plate was the mashed potatoes and they were still quite good. We got a lakeside table with a gorgeous view of the lake as the sun went down. Also an interesting view of the chickens roasting on a large spit. The entire waitstaff portrayed joy in their jobs and made sure that the experience was awesome. One of the managers checked on us twice, once early in the meal and once again after we had had a chance to really determine if it was as good as we 1st thought it was. It is a little pricey for us but comparative to Charleston's for the same meal, but better flavor and better ambiance.

I just went last night and I want to go back! Nice casual-upscale restaurant. You could go dressed up for an evening date, but you could also bring the kids. I have a younger kid and a toddler and they liked all of the food we got! Even the house salad, they really liked the Adobe dressing. They don't usually like salad! Very large portions, my husband eats a lot, and he had to share his meal with the kids (who liked his entree better than mine) and still had enough for himself.  I think I have enough leftovers for two meals. Service and staff were awesome; never had an empty glass in front of me and waitress/hostess were friendly.

We enjoy eating here but we dont do it too often because of the limited menu and the cost is on the higher side. The food is always good and the atmosphere is nice if you want to look out at the water. The service is always attentive and friendly, always a great group of young people. It was a nice place to have a Valentine's Day dinner, we got there early to beat the crowd.

The venue is gorgeous, staff attentive, and most importantly the food is sensational. Every side, every element of my meal was cooked to perfection. Definitely somewhere I plan on going for a long while to come.

name: Hideaway Pizza
address: 901 N Broadway Ave #5810, Oklahoma City, OK 73102, USA
reviews:
Everybody loved the pizza, both the one with red sauce and regular crust, and mine with Alfredo sauce and a cauliflower crust. The wife liked her salad as well.  The garlic knots we got as an appetizer were a hit as well.

Friendly waitress (December, who was tipped well for the excellent service), nice clean restaurant, decent craft beer selection. We ate here on a whim, since we weren't familiar with the area, and we were not disappointed. Will definitely be back again next time we're in OKC!

Great Food, Great Service, Great Environment. 
The fried mushrooms are delicious! And super affordable. I ordered the "Capone" and I'd highly recommend it. Every ingredient was fantastic and cooked well. Madison, "Madi" was our waitress + she was awesome. The mudslide dessert was great too!

We went to Hideaway Pizza on a Friday evening. We were able to find a parking spot and walk right in and had to wait a short time to get a table. We ordered friend ravioli which is delicious and a Maguerita pizza. The pizza was good. The French fries were good too

I went with a work group and this place was fantastic. The food was amazing and the atmosphere was great. They can also do half and half on any size pizza with any of their speciality pizzas. And if you get a drink other than water, they give you a cup that you can keep at the end. Definitely recommend.

OMG this place has perfected pizza I live near the one in Fort Smith Arkansas 3-4 hours away and let me tell you they are both great. So 5 stars everyone I would highly recommend you try every one of their pizzas I have lol. And they are all 👌

name: Trapper's Fishcamp & Grill
address: 4300 W Reno Ave, Oklahoma City, OK 73107, USA
reviews:
This was a pleasant surprise. Of course the atmosphere was great, outdoorsy, camping / fishing feel to it. They were very accommodating as came with a group and more people showed up than we thought so we needed to move tables!  
The catfish was great along with the creole potato salad as a side. The service was outstanding as well.

The waitress Ashley was a great server. It was very attentive and I had a good sense of humor. She was very knowledgeable in the menu. That's working in the restaurant industry for over 20 years. It was nice to see somebody that know that they're doing a good job. Thanks, Ashley. Next time we come to town we will stop in.

Beyond delicious.  Love the Prime Rib. I am giving 5 stars ... Because we have eaten here many times and this is the 1st we had bad bar service.  Super nice servers  Feel good ambiance and the food was outstanding.  The quail legs little, but delicious.  ... Although we suffer a bit of bad service with the food service at the bar... Still a Quaint space and location w/ a proper bar. An easy favorite for the OKC area.

One of the best places in Oklahoma City to eat. The crab cakes are amazing and the shrimp on a shingle is some of the best shrimp you will ever eat. Their blackened prime rib is the best you will ever eat. Same thing with the blackened redfish. Everything on the menu is top-notch. To many things to list. And many different kinds of food on the menu for any kind of appetite. I eat here all the time and highly recommend it to anyone.

We have been here 3 different occasions as we've come into OKC from the Tulsa area and have loved it each time we've been. Found it completely on accident, the first time and we're so glad we did. The food has never disappointed and neither has the service. It has always been wonderful, timely and the atmosphere is great also. We will continue to come back when in town. Our server Matthew C. was a delight on our 3rd visit as well.

name: Ranch Steakhouse
address: 3000 W Britton Rd, Oklahoma City, OK 73120, USA
reviews:
The place is perfect for a luxury date night. The steaks were cooked beyond perfect and the cocktails were deliciously blended. The butter for the rolls was so sweet and delicious I had to have more rolls.
This place is pricey with the lowest entrees being $30 and going as expensive as a $80 steak. All steak toppings are extra. The sides are all a la carte family sized portions for $10. But the service and quality are top notch as the atmosphere is wonderful for a date or family gathering. 
I would highly recommend trying this place for yourself if you want to feel fancy.

We have lived in Oklahoma City for 18 years. The finest steaks have been served by Ranch, Mahogany and Red Prime during that time. When the Mathis Brothers took over, a clear improvement was made in management and execution as well as quality of items served. Now, I would suggest Ranch is one of the best steak and seafood restaurants in the nation. At this point, I take all my out of town guests there, and no where else. It’s actually amazing how consistent the quality has been over the last 2 years. Bravo!

Good food. waitress was very knowledgeable and made it easy to help me know what to order as a first time steak eater. You get what you pay for and don't even think of going if you're not ready to spend at least $100.00 . This wine was amazing $15.00 / glass. We Will go back after we win the lottery.

The steak is good. The place is nice. The prices are expected. I would only come back on special occasions. The ambience is much like I would like a place titled “the ranch” should be. I felt immersed in the experience of my food. 
The four stars come from comparing steak houses in Oklahoma City. RED - another steak house in Oklahoma City has comparable prices and ambience however the steak melted in my mouth and was much more buttery in texture than The Ranch. If the provider of the meat is the same then it is an issue that can easily be resolved in the kitchen. If, on the other hand it is a different provider then I would simply recommend RED if you live closer. 
If you live closer to The Ranch it is not worth the drive. Going to The Ranch will fulfill your palates craving in full.

Wow, just wow!  I ate dinner here recently and was honestly the best restaurant experience I've ever had.  

The food was absolutely out of this world.  Their grilled shrimp just incredible, Wagoo like nothing I've ever tasted before, mac &cheese with crab just amazing and finally, a steak which was incomparable to anywhere else!

Justin was our waiter and if you make a reservation, ensure he's your man; just an incredible guy.   Super knowledgeable about the product, where it came from and can recommend complimenting foods like you wouldn't believe.

The restaurant itself has a fantastic upscale vibe.  Very aesthetically pleasing, and plenty of seating.  There are also a couple of private rooms and an awesome outside area.

There is easy parking out front, and it's easy to spot from the main road.  I cannot WAIT to go back.  Incredible.

name: Charleston's Restaurant
address: 5907 Northwest Expy, Oklahoma City, OK 73132, USA
reviews: I love to come here for the prime rib. You can choose raw or creamy horseradish and they cook it perfectly to your liking. They also have the best LITs. They also have awesome baked potato soup.

Great food and service. It's far from where I live, but their service really impressed me, especially with the manager double-checking on us because of a few minute wait for some of our party's food to be ready (they ordered something that took longer to be cooked). Our waitress was also more attentive than most other restaurants I've been too lately, which was refreshing. Definitely made us feel like valued customers. I was pleasantly surprised by the service. Great food for the price level/tier. I'm not sure if their food is unique, but it's good for the genre of food that it is. If you're in that part of town, I'd say it's definitely worth going to. Their salads, flatbread pizzas, and steaks are usually what we get. I can't speak for their other food, or their seafood (?), but the usual food we order we have liked.

Moved here from Seattle, read the reviews on this restaurant and decided to try it.
I read there was a favorite sirloin that was marinated in soy honey and ginger and asked about it because it was not on the menu.
They were out of that particular steak on this Sunday eve but my waitress Patty said they did have a marinated Hawaiian ribeye (also not on the menu) and I chose that.
It definitely was an up-sale $ from the menu sirloin but it was totally worth it.
I ordered my steak pink and juicy inside which I consider medium and it was perfect.
I also read a review that their carrot cake was scrumptious so I ordered that for dessert and I have to agree it was delicious!
My waitress Patty deserves kudos for being one of the best servers ever.
I also have to mention Michael who continued to keep my water filled and made sure to ask if everything was to my satisfaction. The service is totally upscale and this fast became one of my favorite restaurants in Oklahoma.

Great food. GREAT SERVICE!!!! Amazing drink. I had the salad. The roll was sweet and light. Just enough salad dressing. My sister had the chicken fried chicken, the mashed potatoes were tasty.  The catfish was pretty good as well. We took the carrot cake with us.

This place is always so good and worth every penny. They have the best service and are always so accommodating. I've been coming here for years. All the Hal Smith restaurants are amazing and if they aren't they will make it right! I highly recommend this place for any occasion.

name: Pearl's Crabtown
address: 303 E Sheridan Ave, Oklahoma City, OK 73104, USA
reviews: Convenient fix for the location. The staff and management were very welcoming. The Appetizers were satisfying(I had the fried calamari and wings). I’d compare the seafood platters to your average seafood buffet style. Mixed cocktails carried a slight punch especially for only $5.00, overall would return to order plenty of appetizers and drinks.

We just finished eating at Pearl's Crabtown Bricktown location Dine In. It was Awesome! Staff and management followed all safety procedures. It was a great and a relaxing experience.  Food wonderful. Everyone be sure a dine in. They are top of the line in food service.

1st time visiting here. Came on our son’s recommendation and was definitely not sorry. Gumbo was excellent and very good. If I had a way to get it home, I would have taken a gallon with me!!!  Red beans and rice was good as was the jambalaya. Service was great and fast. Will visit again when we are in town.

The waitress was great. Dishes were dirty, had to send them back several times, finally asked for plastic cups, the food doesn’t taste Cajun and they serve it With Old Bay which is Baltimore not Louisiana seasonings. I’m from Louisiana and the food didn’t have any Louisiana spices on it. Drinks were great. 1 hour wait to sit and about an hour wait in the food and my crab cakes cake out one at a time. I will never eat here again. I spent $$$ at this place and I will not be recommending this place to anyone.

Outstanding oysters! Best I have ever had, and we frequent coastal restaurants! Our convention-training partakes of Pearl's  every first week of March. The only issues are they always run out! We love this place!

name: The Drake
address: 519 NW 23rd St STE 111, Oklahoma City, OK 73103, USA
reviews:
Take a step back to a more elegant time. The dining room is at first a jolt to the senses,as it is very open in stark contrast to the visually busy street outside. But that jolt is fleeting as your senses absorb the beauty and aromas of the atmosphere inside. 

As ample as the space inside is, and as open and airy as the room feels upon first entrance, the seating brings you in comfortably close. The booths provide you with a cozy "snug" which somehow magically envelopes your group making for ease of conversation regardless of how full the restaurant is, in no small part to their ability to block out sound from around you.

Each element of hardware, material, flatware, furniture, and decor are masterfully paired with one another culminating in the most cohesive and coherent story being told through design. 

That story is undeniably, "Welcome back."

Not just welcome back to the restaurant,  but rather welcome back to a time when elegance, service, and product mattered.

 When style with a smile was in.

To say the service was phenomenal would be a disservice to the level at which the people here hold themselves. They deserve a standing ovation for the level of detail the amazing people here achieve in even the smallest interactions with the guests.

The food meets that standard and more. Voluminous portions pair with stratospheric  flavor. There is value in what you partake of here. Every dollar counts toward the end product of what can only be described as an occasion. 

Of the many places one could choose to treat your palette, The Drake is by far the greatest and only choice for me.

The ambiance was great, the service was wonderful, the food and drinks were superb! We had a bigger party than initially expected, but they were very accommodating and more than willing to make sure everyone fit comfortably. Our server was very pleasant and knowledgeable, she made great recommendations and was willing to go above and beyond for all our requests and concerns. We had the lobster roll, the crab cake - avocado special, and some oysters and were genuinely pleased with everything we were served. We’ve been on an “OKC food tour” and have been disappointed over the last few months but The Drake restored our faith in the food scene. We’ll definitely be back to try one of the private cubicles!
Great service and unique menu. The family style paella was the best and a favorite each time I visit. Overall a great place for seafood dishes that are different and more fusion type cuisine.

Valentine's dinner. Had reservations...got the tiniest table. Everytime the waitstaff brought something we had to juggle for space. They apoligized over and over for the tiny table. We had to put the bread plate on the bench seat. Crazy tiny! Dinner was mostly great. The grilled and chilled shrimp were tough. For $19 they should be cooked correctly. Clam chowder did not taste like clams. Tasted like potato soup. Calamari was terrific. Crab cakes delish.

Our waiter was fantastic! Very sweet and courteous. Food was amazing. Oysters were very fresh! Drinks were phenomenal! I recommend the Cucumber Margarita and the Bloody Mary. I'm extremely picky and they were made to perfection!  Our first time there. We will be back.

name: Patrono
address: 305 N Walker Ave, Oklahoma City, OK 73102, USA
reviews: I don't have to go to New York, San Francisco, or Dallas for truly unique food. It is right here in Midtown OKC! Simple elegant food with tremendous flavor. A one of a kind restaurant that provides a wonderful dinning experience.

My family and I love this place. We live close by and are somewhat of regulars there. Every time we go, we are always greeted with smiles, hugs and “good to see you” from the entire staff. The food is incredible, the drinks are stellar and the ambiance is soothing. Highly recommended.

Great ambiance and service. My food was too spicy for me, so I didn't enjoy it much, but that was more personal preference than food quality. On the flip side, a few of my friends with me didn't enjoy their food very much either, so mixed reviews overall. As with many nice restaurants, portion size seems small given the price for them, but with the bread they brought before the meal, I was comfortably full. I'm not, however, in any hurry to go back.

Wonderful dining experience! I had the mushroom risotto with a chicken breast on the side. They were excellent. The chicken almost melts in your mouth. Service was exceptional too. Definitely will be back!

Fantastic pork chop, butterscotch pudding was ok, veggies in both my and wife's dishes were perfect.  They were accommodating to my wife's allergies and were super friendly.  Service was quick.  Not cheap, but appropriate for the quality.

name: Vito's Ristorante
address: 7628 N May Ave, Oklahoma City, OK 73116, USA
reviews: I travel often and try to eat local as much as I can. Do yourself a favor and eat here! You walk in to an intimate dining area, and are immediately greeted by the family members that own the spot. I got my food to go, and it was a fast turn around. Everything was delicious. From the included bread, to the creamy potato soup and savory entree. I stuck to the classics, spaghetti with meatballs - large portions, and absolutely amazing flavor. If you've ever had authentic Italian home cooking, you'll appreciate this place. I'll be back anytime I'm in town! Highly recommend, both in taste and service.

Extremely friendly service.
Food was tasty and well-priced.
Fairly small eating establishment compared to most other restaurants.
Would recommend.

A+++ service! The food was delicious. From the salads, to the entree, to the suggested wine pairing, to the lemon creme cake for dessert. Clean restaurant and restrooms but still quaint and casual. Again, I can’t say enough about the service. We will definitely be back.

This is a really small, quaint restaurant that is very welcoming. Think small space, small menu, big welcome. The moment you walk in the door, you are greeted like family and they joke about pulling up a chair for you. It really is small, so if you go during peak hours, consider making reservations, and good luck finding parking. (There is a little overflow parking at the shops next door.) The chicken carbonara was a bit bland/not full of flavor, but it would appeal to most. We came at a peak time, without reservations, and there was a race being held in town that weekend, so they were totally packed. We still managed to be seated immediately, but the service was very slow. The waiter was scattered and seemed rattled. He forgot several items, and dropped a couple things. Otherwise, it was a pleasant atmosphere.

I'm from South OKC, and this is the best Italian I've ever had in the state, and frankly this might be the best food in the state. I judge ever Italian restaurant by their red sauce, and Cathy's Sugo is the best red sauce I've ever tasted. And everything was delicious! We dined at Vito's on a whim, and we were pleasantly surprised by the service and the atmosphere. The place was small, yet it teemed with life. People old and young and everywhere in-between were made to feel welcome. The staff were all incredible and very friendly. It's a rare treat to be taken by surprise by such a splendid restaurant. We even ordered extra for carry-out so we'd have ample leftovers. We'll be sure to make trips up north just so we can eat at Vito's again.

name: Nonesuch
address: 803 N Hudson Ave, Oklahoma City, OK 73102, USA
reviews:
Such an amazing and unforgettable experience. 
Everything about Nonesuch was enjoyable. 
The staff was incredibly knowledgeable and attentive. 
Each course was timed perfectly. 
My cup was always full. 
The food was sensational. 
The music was something of a heavy metal and was superb. 
The best part was the fact that they were able to create 100% vegan options.
The vibe of Nonesuch is upscale and laid back blended into one. 
I highly suggest giving Nonesuch a try.

The perfect place for a date night. Nonsuch is a GREAT restaurant.  From the moment you arrive, you can feel that the atmosphere is nothing you've even experienced before. The entire staff are consummate professionals. It's a sensory overload of sight, sounds and aromas.
 Be flexible with your dates because you will most likely need to book months in advance
This is a great place.  It is small, and the service is wonderful.  It has a set menu that changes seasonally.  The food is exceptional and very different.

We dined at Nonesuch last evening and were blown away by the amount of effort they went to in creating visually stunning micro dishes.  Unfortunately, most of the courses lacked depth of flavor and they were tiny.  We felt like we spent way too much money for a tiny amount of food.

Nonsuch’s tasting menu is a great adventure to say the least. The presentation, service, and staff are fantastic to say the least. Some courses worked great while others fell short. The experience was nice but the portions are quite small. You will definitely go grab some food after this tasting menu.

name: Grey Sweater
address: 100 NE 4th St, Oklahoma City, OK 73104, USA
reviews: Hands down the best dining experience we have had in the Oklahoma City Metro area. Every course was delicious and beautifully plated. The wine parings were excellent, two in particular were perfect. However, what really stood out was the customer service. Everyone throughout the entire experience was exceptionally kind and attentive. I am not sure we have ever had this caliber of a meal presented with this kind of warmth. It is the perfect spot for a special occasion.

My husband and I went to Grey Sweater for our anniversary dinner on November 30, 2019. We had a reservation on the early side and were the first guests that evening. We were seated at the counter so we were able to see all the prep and interact with the chefs/staff throughout the evening. Every single person we interacted with was friendly, informative and so enjoyable! 

Shortly after making our reservation, the restaurant called and asked a handful of questions. In answer to one, we told them we honeymooned in Germany. During the course of dinner, they brought out a German beer as a gesture to personalize our experience. It was so appreciated! 

Twice throughout the evening, Chef Black came over to chat with us and to make sure we were enjoying ourselves. It's always a pleasure to interact with the chef! Chef Black was so friendly and approachable, and when we left, he genuinely thanked us for choosing Grey Sweater and wished us a happy anniversary. 

In addition to the second-to-none service, the food was INCREDIBLE. Every single course was something special and new. We dine out often and love coursed dinners like this one. We chose the 7 course dinner (for our 7th anniversary), and all seven courses were so special. 

Some highlights: 
- The sous-vide parsnip (first course) made me wonder why I didn't LOVE parsnips all along! The texture and flavor were unlike anything I've had before. 
- The scallop was my favorite course 
- it was the most delicious and perfectly cooked scallop I've ever eaten. I could have eaten ten of them! - The sea bream in a carrot top "chimichurri" was my husband's favorite - with a subtle but certain background heat. 

The wine pairings were perfect (we did the silver pairing) and the amaretto they finished with was another welcome surprise (who knew I loved amaretto?!) Overall, this night was perfect and we cannot wait for a repeat very soon!

My significant other and I dined here last night, and let me tell you - it was a phenomenal experience. Each course was tantalizing and delicious, but the real standouts (for me at least) were the dessert and the scallop. Absolute bliss. If you're planning on visiting this restaurant, definitely spring for the wine pairing. My significant other isn't a huge fan of wine (but I am), and let me tell you the sommelier knocked it out of the park with each and every course and earned both of our stamps of approval. She was also exquisitely pleasant to talk to and it shows that she takes pride in her work. 

The only thing I would caution the staff (and patrons)  on is to pay very close attention to allergies. In my reservation I mentioned being allergic to peanuts, peas, and lentils (what can I say, legumes and I just don't get along) and the menu was adjusted so that I avoided the Thai peanut sauce, but in another course I was served a sauce with peas in it. I'm not extraordinarily allergic to legumes (plus I don't like making a scene), so I didn't say anything at the time, but for those with more serious allergies it could be a larger issue. It didn't stop me from enjoying the course by any means. 

All in all, if you are looking for a place to celebrate a special occasion (or just enjoy seeing where the art of food can be taken) I would enthusiastically recommend Chef Andrew Black's Grey Sweater. I look forward to visiting Black Walnut very soon, as well.

Overall, the experience was average. We have been to Nonesuch, so my expectations were very high. The 7 course tasting menu was good, but does not even come close to Nonesuch’s 10 course tasting menu  (which is cheaper than grey sweater’s 7 course tasting menu, by the way)...I am also not a picky eater, but there was a pear/ice cream dish (not the dessert) that I did not eat because it was not worth eating. We went for my boyfriends birthday and he was poured a significant amount more wine for each pairing...we weren’t going to mention it, but when he brought this up to the sommelier, we were told that “we had been poured more wine than normal the entire night”. After this awkward comment, he brought me two more tastings of the same wine and told me I “didn’t have to share with my boyfriend” if I wanted more wine. I felt that the entire experience was not worth the cost and if anyone wants an exceptional tasting experience, 100% go to Nonesuch.

So somehow I got an invite last night for the preview of a new restaurant soon to open in OKC!!?!!!!!? @greysweaterokc is so awesome. The drinks we had and the food tasting was amazing! I am already a huge fan of @blackwalnutokc and now @chefandrewblack has his new venture with @greysweaterokc This is sure to be a warm, inviting and delicious.

name: Mahogany Prime Steakhouse
address: 145 W Sheridan Ave, Oklahoma City, OK 73102, USA
reviews: Had high hopes for a great meal, however, there signature lobster appetizer was like eating a salt block. In fact everything was way over salted. Steak was which was a bone in felled was very tender and tasty minus the top  layer of salt. The salmon was to salty to eat. The tuna appetizer was very good and cooked perfect.  For desert the key lime pie was good. Not the best I’ve ever had but still very good. The cappuccino was served in a large mug and seemed watered down. The service was great however and the manager did take the salmon and lobster appetizer off the bill so I was treated fairly. Take away is chef just needs to lay off the salt and let the flavors of the food come through.

This steakhouse has excellent service and great food. Our server was very accommodating, and our food came quickly. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone looking to celebrate a special occasion. The parking was a little tricky.

My girlfriend took me to Mahogany for my birthday this year. I had very high expectations, and Mahogany met them easily. There was a birthday card waiting at our table that was signed by the staff that night. This was very thoughtful. Both waiters were polite and educated on their menus and services. All staff members that checked on us wished me a happy birthday. The crab cakes and wedge salad were great, but the real prize was the NY strip and lobster mac n' cheese. Thank you again Mahogany, it was an excellent experience!

Our experience was outstanding. The service was spot on, not annoying but my glass never got low, very friendly, attention to detail! The food was excellent, may be the best steak I've ever had; I've ate at Ruth's Chris, the Cattleman's, and other chain steakhouses, this steak was better by far! The lobster cargot is a must try if your a seafood fan. The dessert was the "icing on the cake"! Delicious and presented well.

One of the best steak houses I've been to in any city. The food is incredible, service is top notch. My kids and I come to OKC every year to see a couple Thunder games and they ask to eat here after every game. They do a great job catering to Thunder fans and the atmosphere after a game is very lovely, while doing it in a very classy setting. Great place

name: Kitchen No. 324
address: 324 N Robinson Ave, Oklahoma City, OK 73102, USA
reviews:
I adore this place! The wait staff was amazing, the food is great, and the decor is so perfect! It's a great place to go to celebrate a big occasion or just to get together with a few friends. You HAVE TO try the chicken pot pie! It's the best pit pie I've had!

Also, the extra big pancake is freakin' out of this world. If neither of those foods are up your alley, try any of the burgers or sandwiches. They are all pretty good. The fries are a little expensive for what they are, but the spicy mayo that comes with it is almost worth it. If you wanna spring the $5 bucks for an okay side of fries you won't be upset with the dipping sauce. 

Give it a try! Its all tasty!

Been in here twice...has a modern feel.  The first time the service was not that great and they were out of a lot of items.  However the second time was better service and the food is great!  The pancake is one of the thickest I have had but manages to stay light and fluffy.

A terrific find!  Seasonal offerings for reasonably-priced but up-scale dining in an attractive and polished setting.  The menu is has offerings for carnivores and vegetarians.  Service is helpful and attentive, without being overbearing.  In our party of four, each ordered something a bit different than and each came away convinced that we'd made the best choice.  The thing that we all agreed on was our hope to return the next time we find ourselves in Oklahoma City.

Hidden Gem ~ the sweet potatoes were super delicious! My favorite ever! Friendly, attentive waiter, patient w/my substitutions. The manager checked how everything was when we were done. Chatted w/us a bit & was super sweet. Highly recommend this simple, elegant little place 👍👍

Cozy and elegant. Amazing wait staff. Most importantly, the food is always excellent. The cauliflower bread pudding was one of the best things I've eaten in a long time. Parking can be a bit of a hassle here, but it's manageable.

name: The Manhattan OKC
address: 210 Park Ave Suite 150, Oklahoma City, OK 73102, USA
reviews:
Stopped by after the OKC Museum thru a google maps search and couldn't have chosen a better place. 
Not too far of a walk..maybe 10 minutes. 
Google directions were spot on.
 It has  a casual elegance.... ages maybe 30 - 60 crowd..  lunch menu had an awesome selection.. we chose sandwiches as lighter fare...and got there just after 3. 
Great drink selection and Manhattan's  on tap.. severely types.. thus the name. Drinks are  what you'd expect to pay in a nicer place. $$
Service was excellent
 Attentive ... sociable and warm. 
Had to call my daughter who lives in OKC and tell her about this gem in the city. For a sophisticated but not stuffy or too noisy date night... this is a good stop!
Ask for Brae as a server.. hes great.
Absolutely phenomenal service and the food is Spectacular. Everything is just so fresh and delicious. I love this place

Staff is amazing.  Owner is very attentive and an all around good dude.  Never had a menu item I didn't like.  The bar has all the standards and rotating seasonal cocktails all of which are generally awesome.  My go to place for cocktails with clients downtown.
Nice little upscale bar and grill. Food is excellent and beer prices are good. Small place but wait staff and bartenders are excellent.
Great service and the chicken wraps are amazing and the food has amazing flavor

name: Cattlemen's Steakhouse
address: 1309 S Agnew Ave, Oklahoma City, OK 73108, USA
reviews:
Can’t say enough good things about this steakhouse. We decided to go for breakfast and oh my the amount of food you get!  We ordered the ham and cheese omelette and the western omelette. They came with your choice of hash browns or home fries, biscuits or biscuits and gravy. Biscuits (homemade) were nice and hot so the butter melted. Our drinks were kept filled the whole time. Unfortunately, we couldn’t eat it all. We left full and extremely satisfied. 

Since breakfast was enough to get us through the day, we decided to return for dinner. The dinner steak is a top sirloin that was cooked to perfection and melted in your mouth. The prime rib was the same. Meals came with salad, your choice of potato and hot rolls (they were huge). We ordered an appetizer which was unnecessary, however, we didn’t know at the time that we would just roll out the door and to our car. Service for both breakfast and dinner was superb!!  

Thank you for making our little getaway special.

By far the best steaks every time I have eaten here!  Having been born and raised in Texas and in the middle of cattle country, i have the authority to make this claim.  But beyond the excellent food, the quality in offering the best experience possible is unsurpassed! I had the pleasure of having Kim wait on me.  Gotta  tell you that lady gives the best service ever! I will surely return again and again!

The BEST of the BEST!! Servers and staff are friendly, fast and professional. They really do treat you like family! Food is always delicious and priced reasonably. Love this place so much! If you’re new to OKC or visiting look no more- come here!!

This is an Oklahoma tradition for great steak. 
We arrived between lunch and dinner and had only a short wait for a table. The prizes were surprisingly reasonable and good portion sizes. We had a great waiter who chatted with us and made sure we had an amazing meal.

Id say 3.5 stars. Steak and potato good.  Salad needs a Little work. They should offer onions in the salad. I was told the house dressing was like a garlic ranch.  Maybe i got a bad batch but there wasnt really any garlic in it. Tasted mostly like buttermilk. Yuck

name: The Jones Assembly
address: 901 W Sheridan Ave, Oklahoma City, OK 73106, USA
reviews: This place is so unique. You can order an appetizer of the cheese and fruit pairing and it comes with established connections of pairing that are fantastic. So different but good tasting. This place is a little fancy for the look and pricing, but the atmosphere is great. Servers are very helpful and friendly as well. Great selection of beers and drinks as well. Worth trying if you are in the downtown area and want a new place to eat or hang out for a drink.

I got to enjoy a lovely evening with my Mom at Jones Assembly for dinner. And let me tell you.....what a fantastic experience! The atmosphere and the service were excellent. My mom got the cheese platter and I the Buddha Bowl. Both of our meals were absolutely delicious. I went ahead and paired my Buddha Bowl with their Moscow Mule, it was very refreshing, and complimented so nicely with the Bowl. 
I will say the Buddha Bowl can be shared between two people.

Everything our (large) group tried here was fantastic! The food was beautifully presented and tasted absolutely delicious. The wait staff caring for us was very knowledgeable and struck the perfect balance between being available without pestering. There was a slight mix-up in our reservation (technically our group's fault, not the restaurant) which the manager handled quickly for us.
I would eat here again without hesitation. I highly recommend this place.

Great place! 
The dips and spreads app was great, as was the steak. The Nashville chicken was good, and seemed popular, but I think there was plenty of other options that were even better!
Drinks were also good. Dixie Dagwood is worth a try.

Quite a happening place! Lots of pretty people and a great bar scene. Also a great dining area that is remarkably quieter than you might think when you walk in. Food was hearty and quick with excellent service.  Specialty drinks were over the top!

name: Yummy Mummy
address: Bay#9 Food Court, 119 N Robinson Ave, Oklahoma City, OK 73102, USA
reviews: What a wonderful new place! So, if we share common interests in Egypt and food, you should love it here as much as we did. We were greeted by such a warm smile in a clean and comfortable place.  The food is amazing! It's not just the delicious flavor or the scent or the beautiful presentation that we remembered while talking about but the feelings it brought on not simply full but something more.  Satiated and happy we were sent home smiles on our faces and delicious baklava in a box to share the memory over later this evening.

Perfect visit from start to finish. Excellent food. We ordered mixed Shawarma and chicken strips/fries. Food quality and temperature...thumbs up. Great service. My family member and I sat in the dining area for a long time talking. Staff were awesome...making sure we had what we needed. They weren’t put out that we sat so long at all! Parking is a little tricky (restaurant is in a crowded strip mall on a busy street) but not impossible. Definitely going back to support this establishment.
The best Mediterranean food. I love the Chicken Fatta. Staff very friendly
The food is excellent.  Very friendly service.  I believe that they are primarily a lunch place, but they are open for dinner as well.
Unique flavors to please.

name: Ludivine
address: 320 NW 10th St, Oklahoma City, OK 73103, USA
reviews: Where do I start?  Wow, wow...wow.  The restaurant was beautiful and the staff was friendly and very knowledgeable.  The chefs killed it.  The chef's tasting menu was out of this world.  Local, fresh and amazing.  Well done Ludivne!

This place is an absolute gem. ✨
Ludivine has a stunning, relaxed yet sophisticated vibe. 
The drinks are awesome, the staff was great and incredibly knowledgeable, and it was immaculately clean!
They also have a great patio. 
I have not tried the food yet, but am excited to return in the near future.

More of an upscale place and not really my taste. More geared to the millennial generation imo. Service was great and the food was interesting, not bad just interesting. If you want something different this is the place to go. Just not the typical place I’d visit again.

Lovely Sunday evening experience with the tasting menu. We had two vegetarians and one no-seafood plus me (who eats everything), and they were able to customize the tasting menu per person. Wonderful service, amazing wine list, superb service... a gem on our trip to Oklahoma City!
The new location is amazing! I enjoy several things on the menu but the bone marrow is unbelievable! Great drinks and fantastic service! Great date night spot or dinner with friends!

name: The Melting Pot
address: 4 E Sheridan Ave, Oklahoma City, OK 73104, USA
reviews: The Melting Pot is a wonderful fondue experience for anyone looking for an unique twist on traditional dining. The 4-Course option is by far my favorite choice on the menu. You never leave the Melting Pot hungry or unsatisfied!

We had the steak lovers 4 course meal again. We grilled our food this time & it was great. We had the loaded baked potato cheese fondue again because we like it the best. We tried the original chocolate fondue this time & I definitely like it the best of all we've tried. It brings out the flavors of your dippers instead of competing with them. Service was wonderful.
Delicious! We sat in the bar area; if you want the other area, make a reservation. But we were very comfortable! The 4 course meal will feed 2-3 people. Great service, great food! Fun experience.

Great service...be prepared to cook your own food and spend at least 2 to 3 hours here to get through the meal. It is definitely a unique experience, fun if you want to spend an evening out, would be fun for a family.

Mary Peacock Smith this may not be the popular opinion but it is my honest one.  I did not like it AT ALL. I didn’t do any research before I went so shame on me for coming unprepared. I knew it had cheese and chocolate fondue and you dipped things in it and that is all I really knew in advance. I heard it was pricey and nice for special occasions. I did not know for $120 that I would have to cook my own food. Sorry but I work a lot and when I go out I want to be pampered. I could have cooked some cheap steak, dry chicken and 3 shrimp at home. Part of the appetizer is dipping bread into fondue. Cheese tasted scorched. Our waiter told us it was his first day and we were his second table so I tried to be patient with him not having much knowledge about the menu or cooking options. He said if we were ordering steak then he recommended the cast iron skillet cook.  No oil and absolutely no seasoning. The skillet started smoking and everything charred and stuck to the skillet because it was so dry. If looks could kill when he first brought us the raw food and set it down and I found out I had to cook it. 😒.  Then he tells us that we only get one choice of dessert because they set us at a table that only had one burner.  The dessert did taste good. I thought I was on a hidden camera show and someone was going to pop out and tell me I had been Punked. My daughter said it was an “experience”. Yes it was a memorable experience. Worst $120 I ever spent. I want to “experience” being pampered. I could have this experience at home. 🤷🏻‍♀️

name: Café Cuvée
address: First Floor of Ambassador Hotel, 1200 N Walker Ave, Oklahoma City, OK 73103, USA
reviews: The staff was very friendly and welcoming! It is a small, intimate and warm environment. The food was absolutely delicious and the portions were good! We shared the chocolate mousse. It was just like s'mores and the three of us all loved it. But the way, the valet parking is complimentary if you're eating in the restaurant! I give it 2 thumbs up.

Pretty cool place. Nice atmosphere. Staff was great. It was clean, good noise level. Food was good but I wasn’t overly impressed for the money. I’ll give it another shot some time, I’d still recommend this place to others.
Great brunch, fresh fruit, delicious coffee, and the chocolate mouse is to die for. The atmosphere is elegant, comfortable and satisfying. Easy to share in conversation.  We will return, for sure.

A very comfortable environment. The lunch menu was varied enough to suit the tables tastes. The service was good. The food was excellent. Had a TABS sandwich and tomato basil soup. (tomato,avocado,bacon & swiss). Best of all it was reasonably priced.

Our waitresses were top notch.  I had the Tuna and it was cooked to perfection but what knocked me out was the vegetables that came with it.  OMG. Delicious.  I also enjoy the French flashcards on the table.and were pleased by the friendly and attentive waitstaff. The atmosphere is warm and inviting and prices are reasonable. I look forward to returning.

name: Charleston's Restaurant
address: 224 Johnny Bench Dr, Oklahoma City, OK 73104, USA
reviews:
Amazing Staff. Great food. Beautiful. 

The food was great and the restaurant is run smoothly. We never had an empty cup and every staff member moved in unison. Table assignments didn't matter, you received quality service and everyone worked together. I was impressed with the seamlessness of the operation. We were visited several times from different staff members. Christian and Joe stand out the most.

Had lunch there today. Food was very good and the service was great!  I wasn't loving the side dish I ordered and was gladly offered another one which was very good. Pricey for lunch but we made the most of it and stayed almost 2 hours😀
Good food and friendly staff! The croissants were absolutely delicious!

I own two popular restaurants in another state, so I'm fairly critical. This restaurant was wonderful. The servers were attentive and courteous, with great presentation. I would hire any one of them in my restaurants. The food was perfectly prepared. We were in Oklahoma City to see a play with 2 other couples and stayed at a nearby hotel. We first chose Charleston's because it was so close to our hotel. The experience was so positive we went back the next night. The first night I had the Hickory Burger. Most delicious tasting burger I've had in years. The second night I had the chicken tenders, mashed potatoes and carrots. Amazing! The tenders were soooo tender! We all were 100% impressed and pleased with the service, the food and the atmosphere. I'll definitely return if I should be back in Oklahoma City in the future.
The food here is so great. I had the rib dinner and the dynamite shrimp. So amazing. The place was nice and chill. The server was attentive. Thanks I'll be coming back.

name: Mahogany Prime Steakhouse
address: 3241 W Memorial Rd, Oklahoma City, OK 73134, USA
reviews:
Wow!
What an experience. Service was the best. From the fresh ingredients to the attention to detail in the presentation of food was great. Taste of everything we had was the best I've had.

I love this place. I have been here twice and will return again and again. If you are searching for not only a good steak, but the best steak you ever tasted, this is the place. The staff is always looking out for you and making sure you have a great experience while you are enjoying your food. Check out what’s on their nightly specials. What ever you order, you will not be disappointed. Try the bacon wrapped scallops. Wow.  Enjoy your time here, you will be like me and say, ‘I’ll be back!’

Really awesome food and service! I'll go with my boyfriend and we'll share dynamite shrimp (my favorite part, sooo delicious) as an appetizer. For entrees, he gets the steak while I get the salmon, both really great options. Overall a nice experience each time, it's his favorite steak place by far and definitely a good choice for a romantic dinner together!
Service was exceptional, food was fantastic. This was an enjoyable steakhouse that I'd be happy to recommend

My sister and I came here for her birthday with my grandparents. Everything was going okay, until half way through my meal I found a piece of black hair about 1 inch long mixed in with my food. I told the waitress, who brought over the manager. He proceeded to mock me and tell me there was "no way" that was from the kitchen, it must have fallen in there some other way. My sister and I have long brown hair. My grandparents have white hair. The hair obviously did not belong to us. He then proceeded to bring out a new dish, and handed me a small flashlight so I could "make sure my hair didn't fall in their again." They charged us for the meal, no discount. I was so disgusted I couldn't even eat the new meal, and was truly disappointed by the poor service from the manager. 

Go eat somewhere else. There are plenty of places that won't treat you poorly after THEY leave hair in your food.

name: Mary Eddy's Kitchen x Lounge
address: 900 W Main St, Oklahoma City, OK 73106, USA
reviews:
Please don´t come and expect great food. There are plenty of other restaurants in Oklahoma City that offer a higher culinary experience for half the price. 
The drinks and desserts are great! Fair price and great flavour. 

The ambience was fantastic on the evening I attended as there was an art show inauguration which allowed for a post dinner show. We went as a large party and the service to the table was quick and effective. The cocktails ordered, flights of scotch and whiskey were all great which is why they deserve 2 stars.  
The baby scallops and ravioli were served with a cold sauce. The ravioli pasta was tasty however if thinner would have cooked better and allowed for the taste of the filling to be present. 
The burger had a bun that seemed to have been just taken out of the bag. The meat was cooked to order and tasty however this is not superior to any specialty burger you could get at other restaurants. 
The chocolate tart was presented beautifully. The vanilla sauce combined with the strong chocolate flavour was exceptional. It was inviting to eat and delicious throughout. 
The drinks had great flavour and well priced. 

All in all I will not come back for any food unless there is a drastic improvement. I will come back for drinks and dessert as the ambience was great for these.

This place is always good! And the atmosphere is amazing. The restaurant is past the bar upfront. Outdoor seating is beautiful. Menus is nice and does change a little. Burgers seem to always be amazing! Good drink! It is a little pricey but for what you get it’s worth it. Fun spot and worth a stop. Sounds funny but you must go to the restrooms! Always a mini art exhibit on the way.

We had the Valentine's Day Menu here. I loved the atmosphere and the experience of going here. (We also stayed at the 21C Museum and Hotel), but that being said I felt like the food should have been exceptional for the price we paid. The food was just good. We liked it, but not in a hurry to go back.

Every time I have been here, I take a mental note to remember to come back asap. Every dish I have tasted here has been above my expectations and this time for brunch was no exception. The brunch menu is amazing and the migas, fried chicken sandwich and biscuits and gravy were par excellence. The fried chicken sandwich is unlike any I have ever tasted with unique flavors that are a secret recipe, which makes it all the more intriguing. Whether day or night, this space is to be experienced and the cocktails that are on the menu are all worthy of trying! Put this on your agenda post haste.

Mary Eddy’s just debuted a new menu and it’s everything. 

I have a nightshade allergy, which tainted my experience before as I couldn’t even order the cheeseboard without some sort of nightshade on it. I always alert the staff, so it was very disappointing to have a dish show up covered in peppers. Truthfully, I had given up and started just going for cocktails only.

Lucky for me, they have tweaked everything and I feel like they really listened to diners on what needed to change. As soon as we sat down, the waiter asked who had the allergy and said they would help me with whatever I needed to have a safe dining experience.

The Chef kindly came out to introduce himself and talked through the allergy as well and said he would let me know any dishes that couldn’t be changed/modified. After that, there was only one time where a server who was just running food didn’t know if the plate he served was allowable for me- we flagged down the waitress and she helped us out, so no foul. I was able to eat an entire meal, including their divine sides (those Brussels sprouts!) and enjoyed a few delightful cocktails! Everything I had was delicious, but my favorite was probably the risotto- it was mouth-watering delicious.

We capped the night with their desserts and cotton candy, then toured the gallery of course! It was a delightful evening and fully redeemed all of my past experiences. I can’t wait to go back! 

Lesson: Always give restaurants a second chance, especially when they present a new Chef!

name: Paseo Grill
address: 2909 Paseo, Oklahoma City, OK 73103, USA
reviews:
We had a wonderful time here for my family birthday celebration. Previous to this visit, I had only had catered food from Paseo Grill. I was excited to finally be trying it at the location to experience the full service.

From the get-go, it’s a little confusing to determine where you should go to be seated. We walked in what felt like the back door and lingered inside. Quickly, someone came to seat us.

The booths in this section all have sheer black curtains enclosing the space. Though it’s a little hokey, we appreciated the extra element of privacy it created.

The craft cocktail choices were varied and seasonal. I happily chose a rhubarb drink which everyone agreed was just delicious. 

The onto the meals. Wow. Everything was perfectly seasoned and flavorful. My favorite part was the cooked carrots.

Service wasn’t extremely consistent, there were some competing large parties in our section, but was friendly when they were at our table.

I highly recommend this restaurant. I can’t believe it took us so long to dine here.

The staff were all so warm and welcoming and friendly. They were very knowledgeable and helpful when ordering.
