You have to save room for desserts if you go there; everything except for one thing is a house speciality and their house-made whipped cream is amazing. They were also very sweet to my little one. Some places who don't have a lot of kids coming to their location can be kind of aloof or cold towards them but they were so sweet and thoughtful. Highly recommend them!

Very nicely decorated.  Food was delicious and well prepared. I ordered the sirloin steak in a coffee rub with brown butter spinach and a jumbo shrimp on top. I also wanted to try the cheese platter but it never made it to the table? All in all Ixwould come here again.

Lauren was a great server! We only ordered apps / drinks & dessert and we were made to feel welcome and were super comfortable. This is our second time here and always leave happy. Thank you for the great service and experience. Will return for all of our celebrations and holidays!

Outstanding!  I Had the bison special for the night...  just ridiculously good!  I eat at steakhouses often while traveling and this was easily one of the better cuts of meat I have ever had! The stuffed scallops were amazing as well.  Highly recommend

name: The Mantel Wine Bar & Bistro
address: 201 E Sheridan Ave, Oklahoma City, OK 73104, USA
reviews: Initially we got sat right at the entrance and by the kitchen, where it was a little noisy. We politely asked the host if we could change seats as it was special occasion and there were open tables throughout the restaurant. Initially she was very busy, but once we were moved they gave us complimentary champagne for our wait. The service and food was perfect! Very grateful for our experience and will definitely be back!

We went on a double date with friends and my friend's salmon was mushy in texture rather than flaky as it should have been. The rest of our food was great! They brought her out a blackened chicken breast to replace the salmon, comped her meal, AND gave her a free dessert! Excellent service from our server Dillon too he was just the right amount of attentive and didn't give any attitude about replacing my friend's food. Atmosphere was relaxed and didn't feel stuffy like some other high-end restaurants. We had a very nice time!

Amazing, attentive staff. They really cared about our whole experience. A very relaxing ambiance with good drinks (cocktails and wine). Very friendly, personable manager who walked around making sure everyone got the most out of their meal, they even brought us some complimentary mashed potatoes for the 2 year old with us.

Decided to give them a try for NYE with my wife. Easy parking, greeted at the door, and seated quickly. They had a set menu for NYE, which is understandable. Nice variety on the menu. 

Service wasn’t too great. I don’t know if the built in tip had anything to do with it, but it took forever to initially take our drink orders, then our food orders. Had a glass of wine and I believe they forgot I ordered it. Waitress blamed it on the bartender and then brought a bottle to pour the glass. Waitress also seemed to know a larger table of guest and went over to chat it up a couple of times. I don’t mind that, but her tables were waiting on things. 

Food was pretty good. Not exceptional, but was good. My wife got an 8oz filet and I got the duck. Thought it was pretty decent. Not $75 per person decent. 

We may go back when there is a full menu and to see if the service is better.

Very disappointed... my husband and I go to The Mantel every year for our Anniversary. This year we wanted to spend NY Eve there. So I booked a reservation. Today I get a call from a young lady wanting a credit card and to charge $160. I’m out Christmas shopping and can barely understand what she is saying. My first thought is who is this calling requesting my credit card. In this fraudulent time... handing out my credit card is a little unnerving. I have no idea who is calling. So I request they call me later. When I get home I decide to call the restaurant. I explain what happened and for them to explain to me what they needed. The young lady who answered had a total attitude. Explained we need a card because it’s the busiest time. 5pm on NYE is the busiest. Really. They need a card and to charge $80 per person. The whole situation was weird but then when I call to ask questions and get attitude I was done. I am coming to eat at your restaurant. I don’t have too. Please cancel my reservation! Customer service and phone etiquette do not exist anymore. I love The Mantel but I will go elsewhere.

name: Rococo Restaurant & Fine Wine
address: 2824 N Pennsylvania Ave, Oklahoma City, OK 73107, USA
reviews: Classy a true hidden gem!! Rococo is a perfect restaurant for a romantic date night, family together, after work drink, or carry out. Excellent food,service and beautiful decor.
Get the crab cakes, for the love of God get the crab cakes. Excellent cocktails. Great risotto. The lobster was perfectly prepared. A six star ⭐️ dining experience. TY Natasha

The food was amazing. The staff was friendly. The only complaint was from my husband. He wanted to order the lamb but they were out. I had the rib eye and mashed potatoes and my husband had the veil with linguine noodles and a side of their fancy mac n cheese. Food was delicious! Great atmosphere too.

The crab cakes are to die for!!! I could have this as a meal!! My husband had the duck and I highly recommend it. Excellent wine selection as well as other cocktails. The servers are very knowledgeable on entrees and helpful on recommendations. I love to sit by the fisktank but not A bad seat in the house. I like  A great Sunday brunch meet up, date night place, reunion or friends night out!!

We ate here for Valentine’s Day. Which also happens to be my birthday. Which my husband told them when making the reservation and confirming the reservation. We sat at the table for 10 min before a waiter even acknowledged us. Then we had to wait for 50 min for our food. About 40 min in, I asked for some bread because I was really hungry. They never brought us bread. We finally got our food. The mashed potatoes were bland. My husband found a hair in his food. They finally brought us bread after we were almost done with our meal (after I asked again). Oh. Ya. And no one ever mentioned anything about my birthday. The only thing the waiter said all night was “we are really slammed tonight.”

name: Parlor OKC
address: 11 NE 6th St, Oklahoma City, OK 73104, USA
reviews:
This place is getting four stars from me due to the difficult location and the parking mess. Other than those two small complaints, the customer service is great and everyone in the building is kind and caring. They are willing to answer your questions with ease, even if you ask a million. 
Its self serve, you can leave a tip at each individual restaurant or bar and it's got a real upper Midtown feel. They have a ton of space and an upstairs and downstairs area. They also have an outside area with fire posts to keep you warm. I would recommend trying this place.

A little on the expensive side,  ordered 3 tenders and fries. Fries were really good and seasoned well. Would of been a lot for $3 but adequate amount for $4. 
Tenders flavored well but a little on the dry side. I'd say average size tender, not large though compared to price. They say served with slice bread. Its just that. Not toasted or anything. And a few pickle slices. Had to pay extra for dipping sauce. Overall I'd be happier if about $3 dollars cheaper total.

It’s a better version of The Collective, or I suppose the Collective could be a knock off Parlor OKC. 
Our server was Paris and she was amazing, as was every other staff member that took care of us. 
Every drink we tried was superb, especially the Tastes Like Fall margarita, it was like an applesauce margarita with real lemon and lime, not a sweet and sour mix. 
There were limited vegan options but they are working on more. 
One of our new favorite places, we cannot wait to bring our friends in!
The food, drinks, and service were amazing, the place was clean, the OU game was on, and staff was top notch. 
I HIGHLY suggest going in to enjoy the amazing patio, or to hang out inside with the relaxed yet upbeat atmosphere.

Parlor OKC experience was pretty good. You have multiple fast casual restaurants all at one place. Pizzas, Mexican, fried chicken, Italian, grilled and more. Ambiance was good, staff was friendly. Definitely worth a visit. Definitely recommended.
Went with a group midday on Saturday, and it was really nice on the patio. Good selection of foods. It would be fun to get small plates from each location to share.

name: The Pritchard
address: 1749 NW 16th St, Oklahoma City, OK 73106, USA
reviews: Stopped in during happy hour on a whim during date night. Bartender was great. Environment was really classy but welcoming. Drinks were really good and priced fair. We'll definitely come back.

Exceptional restaurant in the Plaza district. Enjoyed the happy hour. Mussels in a white wine/cilantro broth was excellent.l The broth alone was delicious and came with toasted bread. Also had the fried chicken thighs and a charcuterie board which was also really good.Good wine and beer options. Check their website out. Highly recommended.
We have been here many times and it never disappoints. It is a great place to grab dinner on a date or with girlfriends. The truffle fries and scallops are both excellent.

From the second I heard the name I suspected this might be a good place. Of course I have a friend who has an uncanny ability to suss out local gems. Loved it. Tried the Jetsetter. A local concoction of white Sangria and Aperol. Then the charcuterie. We had two. Everything was perfect. Loved the charred cauliflower and Brussels sprouts.

A gem, I tell you! If the decedent cuisine and artisanal cocktails aren’t enough for you, then perhaps the baritone voice of the ever-so-polite server will soothe you into contentment. I guess what I’m saying is they make good food.

name: Charleston's Restaurant
address: 1429 W Interstate 240 Service Rd, Oklahoma City, OK 73159, USA
reviews: Enjoyed the elegant and relaxing atmosphere and had great service this delicious meal was worth the money

ALL of the staff was helpful. Management gave us a complimentary app because the app we ordered took longer than expected. You must try the shrimp cargot. Simply amazing. If you're a rum person, get the Rum old fashion. Its a good, strong, smooth drink. Other than that, everything was awesome. Kids and wife enjoyed their food. Our cups were always full. Great job as usual.

We had the pleasure of being served by Carson this afternoon. My wife ordered the Ruby Red Trout and I had the chicken tenders. The vegetables are cooked very well. The tenders were scrumptious and the trout was quality. My water glass was almost always full. We also had the spinach artichoke dip which was a great appetizer.
Great service at the bar!  If you're looking for a higher end  mid-range dining restaurant, this is the place for you.  Will come back.

We love taking our customers out for dinner at Charleston's! This is always a great place to go for any occasion because of the awesome food, fabulous service. The atmosphere is wonderful! We also take our grandchildren there because they're definitely kid-friendly. Having a great menu for the children.

name: Charleston's Restaurant
address: 5608 W Memorial Rd, Oklahoma City, OK 73142, USA
reviews:
Went to the Memorial Road restaurant for a week day lunch. Got there 11:30 ish. Party of 3, got seated right away and had our order taken quickly. Service was good. Food came out timely and as usual, it was great. Had loaded fries as an appetizer. 2 Walt’s champagne salads, and pork chops, 2 sodas & 1 water. Tab was over $70.00.

Kinda pricey for lunch. 
With all that said, we will go back.

Appetizers, side dishes and main meal were good.

Unfortunately, we were seated at a dirty table, given a drink in a dirty glass (food caked on the outside) and given a dirty menu.

Once we were able to get our waitresses attention, it was quickly addressed.

Several if the individuals bringing out the food to our table looked and acted like they didn't want to be there.

I really like Charleston’s for a simple date night, dinner with friends, or even a nice lunch. My husband and I will often order from the curbside pickup and service inside the restaurant and out is great. I try something different almost every time I’m here and am rarely disappointed. I’m not a fan of their baked beans, but everything else I’ve had there (prime rib, chicken, soup, salad, catfish, etc) has always been really good. My husband is absolutely obsessed with the salmon Caesar salad. It’s his favorite! The baked potato soup is also very good. I would definitely recommend coming here!

Charleston’s has several locations and they are always good! I do wish they would offer some more options, but they have many staples that are always good. 

Specifically, the croissants, glazed carrots, mushrooms, and roasted chicken tend to be my favorites. The dynamite shrimp is a nice appetizer as well!

I primarily go for after work drinks with friends at the bar.  The restaraunt is consistently good food with good service, a bit pricey for a family dinner.  THE BAR is excellent.  Ask for the Tito's Vodka Press with fresh pineapple and strawberry mulled in, then not sweet or sweet.  Happy hour food is great.  Bar service 👏.  I like my drinks strong, and they get about a 2.5 on 0-5 scale for me, with 5 tasting strong.

name: Firebirds Wood Fired Grill
address: 1320 W Memorial Rd, Oklahoma City, OK 73114, USA
reviews:
Service is top-notch. Absolutely the best I’ve probably ever experienced. The server was funny, friendly, on-point, and in the bustle of a Saturday night, didn’t miss a beat. 

The food was alright. It’s pretty pricey for the quality though.

Went to meet friends there on Friday night... Very busy but was able to get a table on the patio fairly quick. Our waitress Tracy was absolutely awesome... Always smiling and very attentive.  My wife ordered a grilled chicken sandwich which was a little dry and the French fries not very hot. I ordered the BBQ Chicken sandwich which also was dry and overcooked... It didn't have much taste other than the BBQ sauce which was good. My fries were also lukewarm at best. Our friends ordered the prime rib which came out great and they loved it.  Fairly expensive for chicken sandwiches with a spare amount of lukewarm fries!

We had a great experience! Food was fantastic, staff was prompt, kind and knowledgeable about menu items. Moderately priced and great atmosphere. Two seating sections reservations both ambient lighting and walk in table tops! Great service all around!

Amazing upscale steak restaurant. It's fairly new so we had been wanting to go here for some time. The restaurant is spacious and feels very comfortable with warm colors and high ceilings. Enjoyed the atmosphere and especially the perfectly cooked steaks. It's a bit pricey but not too bad. My wife and I went pretty much all out and it was about$120.00 including 20% tip. Food was worth every penny. Nice wine list and great service. Will definitely be back.

Just ordered take out and we got the family meal deal grilled chicken, salad, mash potatoes and dessert. Food was amazing and the packaging was phenomenal. We appreciate you guys being open and serving great food during these trying times!!! I also have a review under northsider66 but wanted a separate review for your takeout.

name: Panang Thai Restaurant S Penn
address: 9022 S Pennsylvania Ave, Oklahoma City, OK 73159, USA
reviews: By far my favorite Thai food restaurant in Oklahoma City. Huge portions at a great price. The food comes out quickly. The staff is super attentive. Sometimes I almost feel bad with how often they come around refilling drinks. The food is top notch. You can choose your level of spice ranging from 1-5. 5 being the hottest. 10 out of 10 would recommend. I go at least once a week if not twice a week.
Pretty good Thai food. Not great by any stretch. The calamari was too heavily breaded with a rough crust. Pad Thai was good. Portions are large. Wait staff is friendly and service was prompt.

Was able to get seated without a wait on a Monday at 1200.  Staff took little time to get our beverages to us.  Their was a little bit of a wait for the food we ordered.  Everything came out tasting well.  Portions were good sized for the price.  Staff kept drinks always full.  

We had looked at other location that were closed before settling on this place.  I am glad we did stop at this location and I will go back.

I love their service and their food. My food has never been wrong. I usually order for pick up, but ate in today with my husband and son. We asked to have our son's order served in a to go box in case he refused to eat. He has autism and had eaten a sandwich not too long before. They happily obliged (and he ate his chicken sate). I love their pineapple fried rice with tofu and vegetables.
Very clean restaurant. Nice staff, and the food was delicious. I highly recommend the eggplant stir fry.

name: Barrios Fine Mexican Dishes
address: 1000 N Hudson Ave, Oklahoma City, OK 73102, USA
reviews: The nachos are the stuff dreams are made of, also a plate to share that will have you saying, these are nachos (not yours!)! The plating of the fish taco was a feast for the eyes and mouth and the crema on some of the other dishes is magical. I love the ambience and care and detail of the food and flavor combinations. Definitely a guilty pleasure of mine and my family's! Even our to-go orders in the past have left us dreaming of our next Barrio's visit.

The service was phenomenal and the food was delicious. I have been there twice and both times it's been great atmosphere. It's perfect for date night or just a night out with the girls (or boys).  It is also perfect for family dinner. The last time I went there was a business meeting, a family dinner and a girls night all happening at the same time. 
 It's medium price but the quality is great. I had a cocktail the first time and it was delicious. The only thing that would make it more amazing is if they had live music. I highly recommend it and look forward to going back soon!

It is a trendy place to get American style Mexican food. I had the beef skirt Adobo fajitas.  The meat was pretty good.  The guacamole was amazing!  A bit pricey so be prepared to spend a bit more.  The salsa is a warmed salsa.  I think it was OK, but I tend to prefer cold salsas.  Parking is a bit hard to find in peak hours so show up early, park at Jerky's or the next block over.
Lovely atmosphere. Good service. The chips were thick and the salsa roasted and fiery. Get the fajitas, mixed - the slaw is interesting and worth slathering down on your taco.

The perfect place for upscale Mexican food. The restaurant was very chic and cute. Service was exceptional and staff was friendly. I ordered the sangria which was good, very refreshing to pair with me meal. I ordered the mushroom tamales with sweet corn, coleslaw, and brussel sprouts with sweet potatoes. I enjoyed everything about my meal. I would definitely recommend!

name: La Baguette Bistro
address: 7408 N May Ave, Oklahoma City, OK 73116, USA
reviews: The little pieces of Persian eatery in OKC.  From the escargot, steaks and the oh so famous chocolate cake- there isn’t anything you can go wrong with.  Besides the delicious restaurant, you must stop in the bakery!  With their incredible cakes, pastries and so much more.  But it doesn’t stop there!  Their meat market is by far one of the best!

Such a cute "French style" atmosphere. The food is delicious, the bread on the French dip slider is amazingly fresh and crisp, some of the best I have had.  The brunch menu is a lovely selection and the bakery has a wide selection of chocolates and other dessert.

Liked the place, very good food and good customer service. There is a table size compromise been done to accommodate more people which made the table to be a little smaller than usual types. Other than the space issue everything is good.

So, when it comes to the food, I'm all in. Their pastries and other selections for desserts are great. You can't go wrong here. 

However... they charge $4 a slice for your cakes from the take out area, and $7 a slice if you want to sit in the restaurant to eat it. That's quite a difference especially considering you are paying for drinks and a tip.

They have excellent pastry. They made a magnificent carrot cake and a red velvet cake for my mom's 90th birthday. We also went to brunch the next day. The selection is extensive. The only problem was trying to decide what to order. Highly recommend.

name: Cajun Corner
address: 9200 N Council Rd ste a, Oklahoma City, OK 73132, USA
reviews: Great place for lunch! The service is fast, and staff very friendly. The food is amazing anytime I come. Never a bad experience! The loaded blacken chicken is where it is at. Also the seafood gumbo is very good!

Had to see what all the hype was about! Will definitely eat there again! Tried the loaded blackened catfish (kind of spicy). The chicken strips and seasoned fries are good. Also had the Cajun fried gizzards. They are not Krispy King but they’re okay. The okra was fresh and crispy and seasoned well. Fat Tuesday specials every Tuesday and a full bar. Also there’s a fire pit outside with seating and a rooftop bar with plenty seating and a great ambience and view. Overall GREAT EXPERIENCE!! 👍🏾

Absolutely amazing food!!! The loaded Blackened Catfish on Dirty Rice is exceptional. Almost everything is fresh and delicious, including the hush puppies. I would also recommend the Shrimp Po' Boy. Only draw backs are the frozen French Fries, not good at all. We will be making a trip back very soon and I will be recommending it to everyone.
Blacken Catfish is amazing.  The Okra is good.  It is not good as homemade, but it is better than most place.  When I am in the town, I definitely coming back to try out all other foods on the menu.

I love this place.  I love catfish and they serve up some great fish!  My all time favorite is smothered blackened catfish.  If you like catfish and shrimp you need to try this at least once.  You'll be glad you did!  It's spicy but you can ask for mild if you're not into spicy.

name: Off the Hook Seafood and More
address: 1920 S Meridian Ave, Oklahoma City, OK 73108, USA
reviews: I eat here often, weekly, to bi-weekly. I love the smothered fries. Catfish is fantastic. Love the gumbo too. Chicken is wonderful. Everything that I've tried is so good! The people that work there are wonderful. Please, please reopen. I'm missing you since the pandemic.

What fun! Really enjoyed our meal and the great staff! The ladies explained how to order, offered suggestions, and explained the specials in a very helpful way. This was not like your typical seafood chain place. It's more lively and fun with excellent food. Fried chicken thighs were tender and crispy, and the grilled catfish was flaky tender! So good and yummy!

Yummy! Our food was so good! I had the grilled catfish, shrimp and grits covered in lobster cream sauce with an extra side of collard greens it was 🙌🏾🙌🏾. My husband had the fried catfish and shrimp basket with okra. My boys had the fried shrimp basket with fries although they weren’t a fan of the garlic fries they loved the shrimp. The service was excellent from start to finish! If I ever visit again I’ll definitely hit up Off The Hook!

Amazing food! I mean, these guys know how to do it! Fast, friendly service. And the food the delicious! Honestly, it tastes homemade!
Everyone I've talked to raves about this place so I gave it a try! I was not disappointed!
It's definitely worth a stop, but it gets busy quick, so get there early!
4 stars because of the wait but food is awesome!  Seafood wontons are good. You only get 6 for 9$. Smothered seafood fries. Yum! Lobster sauce needs dialed  down though   Would recommend and be back

name: The Press
address: 1610 N Gatewood Ave, Oklahoma City, OK 73106, USA
reviews: Had a quick appointment in OK today and thought I would stop for some good food. Recommended the vegan nachos. Location was fairly easy to find, as it is nestled in the corner. Pretty open space upon entering. Immediately seated. Quick food arrival. The sweet potato fritters are just enough sweet. I felt like I was at the Texas Fair. Fried everything!!! Then the vegan nachos....😳🤤 By far on the top of the list for best nachos. Nothing left on the plate. They have a kid's menu too. AND portion size was legit. Left full and happy. Totally satisfied!!!!!!

Well thought out menu, friendly staff, warm atmosphere. Can be a little loud... It's an open setting, a lot of tables and seating, so it might feel a little crowded, but honestly it was nice that we didn't have to wait, even though it seemed a bit busy. Food was delicious & a generous portion & very fair price. 
Only thing I'd like to mention is that it is tucked away on a side street & you normally can't park right next to the building due to limited space, but the district is nice to explore & walk around especially in the warmer weather. So I would recommend getting the full experience & check out local shops as well.

Nice place in the plaza district. Noticed it had a bar area. Fresh food. My husband had the breakfast bomb and I had the breakfast hash and a side of Mac and cheese. Large outdoor seating. The weather was nice today so the patio seats were getting full. Would definitely go back.

During this social distancing time, we ordered the carry out Easter Dinner and it was so amazing! The glazed ham was so good and the scalloped potatoes were to die for! Best deviled eggs ever! Carrot cake was delicious!

I’ve been wanting to try the food here FOREVER but the stars hadn’t aligned. I’d been in and had a cocktail but no food. I love the layout, it’s super cute and laid back. Finally got to try the food with a bunch of friends and it was fantastic! I got the nachos and my friends got the smothered hash browns and they were both great! I especially liked the smothered  hash browns (with chili). I got the buffalo Mac and cheese for dinner which was pretty solid. My husband got the chicken fried steak which he really enjoyed, and everyone else liked their food! I only have a couple criticisms: I got an old fashioned and it was SO SWEET. Maybe it’s just the style there but it tasted like it was laden with sugary stuff which just wasn’t very good. Also, I’ll give this place five stars when they stop serving straws without customers either asking for them or at least be given the option. It’s a huge waste and I always, always refuse straws when I’m out at restaurants. I don’t like not being given the choice, at least. Other than that, I definitely love the food and would eat here again.

name: Mickey Mantle's Steakhouse
address: 7 S Mickey Mantle Dr, Oklahoma City, OK 73104, USA
reviews: From the minute we stepped out of the vehicle, our whole experience was amazing! New Years Eve with out of town friends... Dinner, drinks & dessert were beyond mouth-wateringly delicious. Awesome atmosphere... friendly, professional & efficient staff followed with a great band (Hypnotiq, if I remember correctly). I could go on & on in detail, but I'm leaving the rest up for you to experience! Mickey's definitely did not disappoint!
Fantastic dining experience! A la carte menu so plan for that, but great steaks and chops.

Simple atmosphere, deep in flavor. Dare I say a home run?! Sorry, had to...only complaint is they were out of vanilla ice cream which is how I generally round out my personal experience at any given steakhouse. The bar was quieter than the main dining room which extremely loud on this particular evening. The filet was simply delicious. Enjoy!

We went for our anniversary, and our expectations where blown out of the water! It was our first time at a fancy place and we where completely lost, but our waitress was extreamly helpful in explaining everything and making us comfortable. It was probably the best meal we have ever had and we will be back again, no doubt in my mind. Made our anniversary that much more special.

Pretty expensive, but the food was great. The service should have been better for the amount it cost for us to eat there. Could have just been the night, though. I have been here a couple other times when it was full of people and had great service. The filet mignon was absolutely perfect in flavor and texture. Highly recommend medium rare prep.

name: Waffle Champion
address: 1212 N Walker Ave #100, Oklahoma City, OK 73103, USA
reviews: This a very popular Sunday Brunch spot. Definitely expect to wait a few minutes in line but it's worth it. I had the Migas and my friend had the Chicken and waffle. Both dishes were delicious and left us satisfied. The drip coffee was also great. We'll definitely be coming back.
Good stuff. Have always Liked WC. I think they trimmed down their menu? Which is fine but it did feel a little limited. Food was fresh and quality, as was the food served.

Lovely place to grab food, it is not all processed, the atmosphere is a cool kind of new aged industrial vibe.  There is just no sense of urgency or order when receiving food, so do not go here in a hurry.  The food is great, I recommend the avocado toast, it comes on a waffle, very unique.

Pretty good, all things considered. Not quite sure if it was worth the price, but I am willing to try it again! Burger and fries and a soda will run you twenty bucks, but the food IS good. Just gotta figure out if the cost-to-yumminess ratio is a good fit for you. Otherwise, it has a good atmosphere and a simplistic menu that is good without being underwhelming.

This place is worth the money! They’re portions are huge on their desserts and sandwiches! 

I love the fact that they’re open late on Friday and Saturday and that they have Maine Root as their fountain. The root beer is amazing! 

Always gonna come back!

name: Bourbon Street Cafe
address: 100 E California Ave, Oklahoma City, OK 73104, USA
reviews: Great service! Tyler our server made the dinner great! Food was good, but for the price I wouldn't say it was absolutely the greatest but not bad. Live band was good but a little loud for our party, we wanted to talk. But if you like New Orleans jazz, they were great!

This was a very cool place. I showed up a little late, but they allowed me to still order an appetizer. I ordered the Bourbon Street Trio. It was Amazing. I also ordered the Moose Drool Brown Ale, very good selection. Smooth and easy drinking. Will definitely be making another stop in to this establishment. The bartenders were super friendly. If you make a trip to downtown OKC, do yourself a favor and stop into this one of a kind eatery.

Wow! A little.slice of New Orleans in OKC. Absolutely loved it. Incredible service with friendly and accommodating staff. Delicious food and drinks. Will definitely be a regular spot for me! Kudos and thank you!

I had a Po’ Boy and my boyfriend had pasta. Both delicious.  Good food made from good ingredients. Had to wait about 30 min to be seated, though it didn’t seem busy. Well worth it if you are in the area. I’ll be going back to try some of their other cuisine.

Came here with family for our adult niece's birthday. We had a reservation for about 30. We were brought to our private room and seated. We had a couple of servers come in quickly to take our drink orders. I was glad to see we weren't cramped together as what's happened in previous places. 

I would like to say that our servers were on point. They were both working diligently to keep our glasses full and checked on us often once our food was out. Not a single person in our party had an issue with their food. Everyone was happy and full. They allowed us time to have cake that we'd brought in and open gifts. Overall this was one of the times we've had excellent service and great food. 10/10 would recommend.

name: Tokyo Japanese Restaurant
address: 7516 N Western Ave, Oklahoma City, OK 73116, USA
reviews:
It’s one of the best Japanese restaurants in Oklahoma. Goof food! Good price! Good service! I’ve been going there for a few years, n they never fail me one time.

Suggestion: lunch specials are the best value.

I am a trans woman. I know that seems unrelated, but the entire staff made every effort, and successfully so, to refer to me with the correct pronouns. Add in top of that the amazing sushi selection, and this is my new go to sushi place. I can't give 7/5 stars or I would

We love love LOVE Tokyo. They've got fantastic sushi, and we enjoy exploring the sake menu while there. They've got something for everybody (who enjoys this cuisine) including non-sushi options... But we've never deviated, because the sushi is that good!

Have been going here for years and they never disappoint. Sushi is fresh af, and the hot meals are always like a home cooked meal(but fancy!) I’m allergic to shellfish and the staff are accommodating for me when I let them know of my allergy. Come here for special occasions or as a treat, for yourself.
Definitely best Japanese food I've had in Oklahoma. The sushi is great! Good vibes too. Can't wait to come back next time in in the area. 10/10 would recommend.

name: Tucker's Onion Burgers
address: 324 NW 23rd St, Oklahoma City, OK 73118, USA
reviews:
If you like Oklahoma onion burgers then Tucker’s is a must! Premium black angus beef and local ingredients make this one of my favorite fast casual lunch spots in Uptown. They are often busy but their efficient ordering method moves things along very quickly! 

You must try the fresh cut fries! They are fried in peanut oil to the perfect crispness. 

Finish it all off with a delicious lemonade (pink or yellow)!

This was my first visit to Tucker's, overall I enjoyed the food.  First, we tried the vanilla, strawberry, and shake of the day. All flavors were good but I particularly recommend the strawberry shake, it was very thick and flavorful. The fries were fresh and delicious, but the burger was not as good as I expected.  I typically like a lot of toppings on my burgers so I ordered the burger with all the toppings except jalapeño, as well as I added bacon. It was way too much mustard on my burger and overpowered the other flavors. I tried my sons burger with less toppings and the burger tasted a little better. My main issue with the burgers were being overcooked, I prefer my burgers with a little pink these were definitely well done. I would try Tucker's again due to the delicious shakes and fries.

A great place to have burgers. The onion burgers are a special and Tucker's does it really well. The burgers are well seasoned and  onions grilled well. Their portions are generous and their milkshakes are really delicious. The atmosphere is really nice too. I would definitely recommend! A great experience.

This place looked like a little hip place to try out so we (my daughter, husband and I) went in to check it out.  From the car it already smelled delicious. They are known for their onion burgers so I ordered a single onion cheeseburger, my husband got a double onion cheeseburger and my daughter ordered a cheeseburger plain and dry. They don't come as meals so our french fries and chocolate shakes were an extra expense. She took down our order on paper sacks with each of our names at the top and was really quick at it. She had to be, this place looks like it stays busy as we already had a line formed behind us. We took a seat at one of the long tables by other people eating.  Besides the noise from customers talking, there's music playing from speakers, a woman's voice calling people by a microphone to come up and get their orders and loud noise coming from the kitchen sounding like pans clanking. Way too loud for me! I barely made out my husband's name when she called us to come up. The shakes were thick and required a spoon, the fries were a big enough serving for two people, so that's nice to know with fries costing $2.95 each. The onion burger was good and messy. I've had a better onion burger but this one was still filling, I had to take the fries home with me. For the three of us it costed $45.57, so more than $10.00 per person. This place also had a few children at the tables and there is a kids menu, but no highchairs around.

My in-laws had never been so we embarked on the first time journey of Tucker's! (Right before we went to the Women's college world series)
They definitely have speed and customer service skills on another level at this place Craving the cookies and cream shake I saw advertised... and I was only slightly hungry... They fixed my hunger! The fries were hot. The staff got our family of 7 order out fast and accurate. The burgers were delicious! The price was just right. I was very pleased with this visit. When in the area again I will stop in as they definitely can fix hunger and cravings. Thank you for being in the right place at the right time!
Respectfully,
Bryan
Moore Oklahoma

name: Florence's Restaurant
address: 1437 NE 23rd St, Oklahoma City, OK 73111, USA
reviews:
5 Star Ambience; Service; Cleanliness; Kindness; and Food! 

Any list of top burgers in Oklahoma should include Florence's cheeseburger. It's a fresh beef patty, on a soft white bun, piled high with pickles, onions, lettuce, and tomato. It's simple and delicious! I could tell by the texture and delicious flavor, the hand cut fries are made with quality spuds.

I plan to visit Florence's in the future, and try, what I'm sure will be another fabulous meal.

I'm so glad we found this place today! My friend and I were looking for some good, home-cooked comfort food and that's exactly what we found! ❤️

The service was friendly, the restaurant clean, and the food was delicious! ❤️

This place looks abandoned until it's lunch time. Man it was packed and I'll tell you why: this food was the freshest home cooked meal I've had in years. Moderately priced similar to chain restaurants but infinitely better food. I had the most tender and delicious chicken fried steak of my life. Fresh mashed potatoes. Green beans that had real green beans in them and were delicious. The only complaint is that they were so busy. Highly recommend, but if you are going for lunch I recommend calling in an order Togo.

This was my first dine in experience at Florence's. My group was there for a meeting with State Capitol employee. Service was stellar, employees were considerate and made suggestions for the first timers. 
They specialize in comfort foods like yams, collard greens and meat loaf with homemade corn bread muffins.
Florence's is packed with the history and culture of the black community. I'm was pleased to see those from all races and cultures participate in the tradition of breaking bread with your brothers and sisters.

Food was awesome. I would recommend the food to anyone. I wouldn’t have normally picked beef tips, but it was the special and it was really good. The wait time was a little long for lunch. (40ish minutes) If you are on a timed lunch, this is not the place for you. If you have time to spare, you will not regret it.

name: Off The Hook Seafood And More
address: 125 W Britton Rd, Oklahoma City, OK 73114, USA
reviews: This place is greatness. Soul food through and through. I got the blackened tilapia with shrimp and so tasty. I also got the collard greens and topped it all off with some bread pudding. Favorite was the fish and shrimp. Collard greens were very good but I could have used a bit softer in texture. I will go back anytime I am back in the area. They do this food right! I so love this place!

Great food, cleaned the plate. Little heavy on the Cajun spice but was still great. Only reason I don't give 5 stars is there is a bit of a wait for your food and at least at the north location there isn't much seating. Our party had a bunch of different plates and none of us were disappointed. Take a trip, eat, but do keep in mind there may be more than a ahirt wait for your order

Have been hearing about this place, and decided to give it a try. Got talked into the Melty Lobster and fries, and I was not disappointed! The place was busy and for good reason, the food is amazing. Fantastic flavors and guys service. And might I also suggest the strawberry lemonade! Wow! Do yourself a favor and stop by for lunch!

This place is amazing!  I had visited the south location on a few separate occasions but had never visited the north location although it is much closer to where I live.  Once again the food was amazing!  We split the lobster melt and two orders of crab wontons along with the shrimp & grits.  It was so good!  This location even has a drive thru which makes it even better!  We will be back again soon.

Only thing I can complain about is the hours. I'm not going to claim to be an expert on Cajun cuisine, but the food is always fresh and absolutely delicious. If you hit em during a busy time, don't be in a hurry to be anywhere. They're absolutely busy for a reason, though.

name: Zorbas MediterraneannRestaurant Bar
address: 6014 N May Ave, Oklahoma City, OK 73112, USA
reviews: I just recently discovered Zorbas, and it has become a new favorite of mine. I went with a group for lunch. When we walked up to the menu, the owner came out to greet us. He introduced himself, asked us if we had been there before, and then gave us recommendations since it was our first time. He was incredibly friendly and his recommendations were amazing (I went with the Chicken Pesto sandwich with the tomato soup - fantastic choices). The place is incredibly clean on the inside with a fitting and classy motif. I definitely plan on making this a routine stop.
I love this place! Atmosphere is very welcoming and as a vegetarian Mediterranean food has the best selection of dishes! definitely the best tasting in town!
Honestly the best Mediterraneann food I've ever had. I got exactly what I ordered in a timely fashion with great service. Great atmosphere even if they are busy. Would love to go there again soon.

Fresh, Clean, Greek inspired Mediterranean food. The Catalan Chicken was amazing. No need for a "to go box". I ate all of it! 😁 It was so good I forgot to take a picture. Sorry, you are going to have to try it for yourself. You will not be disappointed.

It was delicious!! I had the Western  Giro with BBQ sauce with Greek salad. Our waiter Reza was excellent,  we never had an empty glass and he was checking to see if everything was good on a regular basis. The birthday message  on my red velvet cake was sweet.

name: Pearl's Oyster Bar
address: 5641 N Classen Blvd, Oklahoma City, OK 73118, USA
reviews: The crab dip is amazing! I also tried the cedar plank salmon tonight. It has a nice sweet Asian flavor to it which nicely compliments the flavor absorbed by cooking it on the cedar plank. It does have sesame seeds, so of you're not a fan of those, be sure to order it without! And if you're a margarita person, be sure to order the Perfect Margarita with Patron - it's incredible! All around great dinner. And if you can sit on the patio, it's beautiful this time of year!

Great service. Cody was nice and very helpful and payed great attention to us. My wife said it was the best Eggs Benedict she has ever had. The Blackened Pork Chops were EXCELLENT! I. Highly recommend Pearls or Trappers Fish Camp restaurants!

Great service, atmosphere is nice, and the food is pretty good. My only down sides here are 1: The price sometimes feels a bit off and a little high. 2: The Lobster tail is hit or miss unless you order just the lobster entree. 3: The ultimate crab cake recipe has changed, maybe it's better to other people so fair enough, but for me it was my go to order with the old recipe!

Seated quickly amazing food and service! I was a little concerned when they told us they didn't accept reservations but they seated our party of 10 very quickly. They gave us two waiters so all of our service was amazingly prompt! I definitely recommend this location for any special occasion. The food is a little pricey but very much worth it.

To give some context to my review, I'm from Golden Meadow, LA and have been born and raised my whole life. Seafood is in my blood and I'm a Cajun by birth. So again, my review is biased. I got the Jambalaya with a side of red beans and rice. The Jambalaya was okay. Just requires more seasoning as does the red beans. They were both very bland in my opinion. Aside from that, the portion was a great nice size with leftovers easily. Little more seasoning and this is easily a 5 star review. Waiters were great and attentive.

name: Stella
address: 1201 N Walker Ave, Oklahoma City, OK 73103, USA
reviews: Our first visit. It was very good. They did not have our favorite dish on the menu. But, the created for us. Awesome food and service.

Had a wedding shower in their back room and it was wonderful. The staff was very attentive and helpful during the event. The buffet spread was very delicious. The flat bread pizzas were perfectly crisp and the Italian sausage gravy was almost life changing. The room was suitable for our party of about 30 without being too cramped.
Nice atmosphere.  Met with 6 friends and the noise level was good most of the time so that we could visit.  Wait staff friendly and courteous.  The food was good.

Very warm atmosphere, food was delicious, and my server was excellent! I had the Mushroom Risotto, and my wife had the Sauteed Shrimp (fettuccine). Price for 2 was $50, music was at a reasonable but, most of all the crowd was chill and diverse. Will definitely come back soon.
Great & friendly staff and the food was great! Will definitely be coming back here again

name: Pizzeria Gusto
address: 2415 N Walker Ave, Oklahoma City, OK 73103, USA
reviews: Came for a work function as it was suggested by coworkers. The place is nice if a bit trendy. The food is good but for me it was nothing special. It's also a bit expensive. They have a full bar with a lot of different drink options, including a happy hour from 4-6. Definitely stop by if you are in the neighborhood. Servers are friendly and helpful.

This place is the first authentic Italian place I have ever been. They answered all my questions. All of their pizzas are twelve inches, but they are more than enough for two, to three people. The pizza is wood fired, in a stove, made in Italy and shipped to the USA. The crust is the key, it's light, airy, crispy, and cooked to perfection. The atmosphere is almost bar style, but is family friendly. With a weekly special and amazing staff, I will be back.

I really enjoyed pizzeria gusto. It's a very hip place and the music is not incredibly loud which I really enjoy. This is a great place if you want to talk with someone. The food here is very good the wood fired pizza is really tasty and they have a lunch special for like $10 a person. another reason this is a great place for lunch is can get in and out pretty quick.

Good place for lunch. Don’t miss the amazing deal for lunch you can grab fresh pizza and with the sides of salads. Worth the meal and worth the prize. Friendly staffs seems to bit busy, but you can book the table. They take reservations too. You have various options to substitute with sides too. Good job team for serving the amazing meal.
Ate here for my husband and I's wedding anniversary dinner. The food was amazing and our server was super sweet. I'd definitely go back for another special event celebration.

name: The Garage Burgers & Beer
address: 1117 N Robinson Ave, Oklahoma City, OK 73103, USA
reviews: Usually get take out from here but this is my favorite Garage location. It’s located in a nice part of Midtown, and the service is also 5/5. The final part that makes it 5/5 is how clean the location is. If you like burgers and beer, this is an awesome place. Their outdoor seating is also a very nice addition.

Good service with variety of burger and drink options. The bar is pretty good as well. You know you can just go to the table and order drinks (no food) if you like to have some drinks only. That is what I do most of the time and then order food. Long story short, full bar burger place with TVs in Midtown.

One of my favorite burger places around here, it's got a taste and style of its own, not like chili's or one of the other sit-down places for burgers. The fries are seasoned perfectly to give them a style of there own as well. The Garage downtown and the Garage in south okc and Moore have a 5 star rating with me! Highly recommended to everyone.

off the bat, customer service was on point. they have very interesting picks on burgers. I got the double cheese burger and it was so bomb, the char on the burger was crispy and it was not drying, truly a good burger. Would recommend if you wanna get a decent burger for a decent price.
Cool decorations, nice attitude at the front counter. Seemed pretty lively at the bar, great selection of games on the big screen. Food was great! Kitchen sink burger is bomb.

name: Gabriella's Italian Grill & Pizzeria
address: 1226 NE 63rd St, Oklahoma City, OK 73111, USA
reviews: Incredible food in an authentic atmosphere! We had a reservation for New Year’s Eve and weren’t disappointed at any point during our meal. The Italian nachos, mussels, and fettuccine Alfredo were all authentic and delicious. Would LOVE to come back.

First thing's first. Make sure you get a reservation to this place before you walk in. Walk ins are accepted, but be expected to wait a while. 

Even with reservation, we waited maybe 15 minutes or so to get a table. They do have a sit down area for you to wait at, which is nice. 

The atmosphere of this place is very romantic and intimate. The service from our server was amazing, and made us laugh the whole night, calling both of us babes. 

I had the home made lasagne and let me tell you, one of the best meals I've had in a long time. 

Ended the night with fried pizza ball donuts, which they call something else. They were pretty good, definitely something you'll want to share. 

Last is the price. Don't come here broke. This is a once in a while great date place, not all the time. The service and the mood of the place will reflect that. You'll be glad you came to this place!

The food was absolutely awesome. For the first time in a very long time I can actually say that I left a restaurant pretty satisfied/content. However they could go a little lighter on the salt when it comes to the Tuscan Pasta, Especially when preparing it with seafood... But other then that! Excellent! Especially for as busy as it was 😊💞💕💞. Spinach artichoke dip🎆 bomb🎆 AF

I came expecting a mediocre experience and was so surprised by the quality here! The staff was friendly, the location was great, and the food was incredible! The bread and dip are out of this world. Pizza and homemade ravioli are a notch above any other I’ve tried. Even the chocolate cake stands out. The prices are not cheap, but you get what you pay for and it is definitely worth it!

Hands down the best Italian food in OKC! We had the toasted raviolis, 6 different entrees, and the Italian Wedding Cake, and every single item was amazing!  All of their sauces are what makes the dishes. Then add outstanding service, was an amazing awesome experience!

name: Nourished Food Bar
address: 131 Dean A McGee Ave #115, Oklahoma City, OK 73102, USA
reviews: If there is a problem with nourished food bar, it is its accessibility.  It's also not a place to have a casual sit.  But if you're looking for a healthy alternative, and you find yourself dowtown, check this place out.  Terrific menu, and staff really seems invested in quality.
First timer loved the GF place in OKC! Love supporting Gluten Free places!! Keep up the good work.

I am gluten free so I was pumped to go somewhere where I could get a sandwich! The owners are very friendly. I got the chickpea mash sandwich and butternut squash soup. Tasty and healthy! The bread was good.

Recently, I ate the special of the week tacos made with dehydrated taco shells, filled with veggies, cashew cheese, pepitas avocados and homemade salsa.  It was so delicious, I went back twice for more! Jamie is so creative with ingredients. His creations are pleasing for the palate as well as for the eyes with all colors and textures.
Delicious!  I'll be back to try everything on the menu.  It's so nice to enjoy yum food and nourish my body.  :)

name: La Brasa
address: 1310 NW 25th St, Oklahoma City, OK 73106, USA
reviews: Great atmosphere for an evening meal. The food was awesome. My husband loved the club drink. A must is the creme brûlée.  Xavier was a great representative of the food and drinks.
La Brasa is amazing, excellent service, a great atmosphere, music played at just the right level, and delicious food!
This is a cool and upbeat restaurant.  Had a vibrant decor.  The food was really good also.

This is such an interesting Peruvian-Korean fusion experience! I love eating here, from the boho chic vibe and delectable dishes, this is a gem in the OKC eating scene. Wine Down Wednesdays with 2 entrees and a bottle of wine for $45 is great! The Tacu Tacu is great, and so is their chicken that is marinated for between 24-46 hours. Definitely check this place out and enjoy lounging and eating well!

Went for a date night, it was satisfying enough. Food is pretty good, and will satisfy your craving for South American cuisine. Had live music when we were there. Place turns into a club after the restaurant closes.

name: Black Walnut
address: 100 NE 4th St, Oklahoma City, OK 73104, USA
reviews: Unique style and flavor. Atmosphere is an upscale urban environment. A bit pricey, but extremely large portions. Most meals could probably be shared. Smaller intimate setting, not ideal for large groups or kids (most kids probably wouldn't eat anything on the menu).

Made a reservation but had to wait. Wasn't too bad since the staff was very friendly and accommodating! Food was very good and I'd definitely come back. Loved everything but especially the fried green tomatoes and mac and cheese!

All I can say is WOW! I decided to try this place after it was ranked among the top 10 date night spots in OKC, and the Mrs. and I were long overdue for a date night of our own. Let me just say we were both blown away by how good the food is. The head chef even came out to ask how the food was. Spectacular is all I could say! The lamb ribs and hush puppy appetizer was amazing. And we had to go big so for our main course we went with the 28 day aged beef ribs that came with grilled veggies and out if this world skillet Mac and cheese! Flavor galore, good portions and fall off the bone tender meat! You won't be disappointed! Lastly, the garage parking is very convenient with the Deep Deuce area being short on available street parking.
The food was excellent. We had the lamb ribs, english beef rib, lavender chicken, and walnut cake. I'd probably pass on dessert next time only because the appetizers and entrees were that good!

My wife and I had a great time here.  Chef Black is such a super nice guy in addition to making some really great food.  Cool place with a nice vibe.  If you need a private room for a corporate event that’s coming too.  Really great space next door for entertaining.  

Thanks Chef for the hospitality.  We’ll definitely be back.

name: Fuzzy's Taco Shop
address: 208 Johnny Bench Dr Suite C, Oklahoma City, OK 73104, USA
reviews:
I had the California Heat and a Shredded Brisket taco with some black beans and rice. 

The California Heat was an insane flavor extravaganza! There's so much of nature's goodness going on there in that little package. It was divine!

We got the food to go. We got some bomb-diggity queso a generous and a generous portion of chips. 

I can't wait to go back!

Tacos are DELICIOUS. I've had the same food at different Fuzzy's, but somehow this one always tastes better? Not sure if it's the location, the heavy throughput, or just the fact that I'm always having fun when I'm here, but the food is exceptional.

The guy taking my order was very patient with me. It was my first time there and I asked a bunch of questions about the menu.  He was super sweet. Thank you. The food i did end up getting tasted really good. Definitely will return.
It's kinda hidden but it's in a cute location right next to the water. The food was good, the atmosphere was wonderful and the guy taking our order was really cute. Would definitely recommend!

I ABSOLUTELY LOVED this place when I was living in OKC. Just found out they have a fuzzys in Cincinnati and wow do they need to take notes from here! Missing this place so much! Loved the people and the menu was Great! Cincinnati needs to step up their game big time 😭
